problems.name: Triforce
problems.description: Lowball.  Sit-start low under left arete, with your right hand on a sloping rail beneath the lip of the boulder, and left on a crimp above the left arete.  Powerful, tricky, and height-dependent, this problem is likely much harder for shorter climbers.  (FA Evan Erickson, 2007)

problems.name: Positive Water
problems.description: Lowball, and a bit of an eliminate.  Sit-start at the right end of the sloping lip on a positive hold, and traverse left to finish at the peak of the boulder.  Squamishy!

problems.name: Hoedown
problems.description: Short, cramped, contrived, and ugly, but still a lot of fun!  Start on a huge, broken horn/slot in a hole just right of the arete.  Avoiding the good, incut edges out right, climb directly up using two opposing edges, to a powerful, sloping top out.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2013)

problems.name: V2
problems.description: Sit-start using good edge.  Head straight up, or head right (joining "Albatross Left").

problems.name: Albatross Left
problems.description: Start as per "Albatross", but head left at the roof to a sloping sidepull, then up the face.

problems.name: Albatross
problems.description: Sit-start low on a hold above the v-notch in the middle of the slab.  Climb up into undercling, and power through to the face above the overhang.  Very height-dependent!

problems.name: Evan's Scary Slab
problems.description: Start on the crack just right of "Albatross", and head up through the blank looking bulge above.  Spooky and rarely climbed.

problems.name: Groove of the Move
problems.description: Start extremely low (virtually lying down) at the bottom edge of the slab right of "Albatross".  Climb onto the slab with great difficulty, and continue up the slab to much easier moves above.  (FA Evan Erickson, 2007)

problems.name: V1
problems.description: Sit-start and climb the blunt prow at the corner of the boulder.

problems.name: Roadrunner Excavation Company Right
problems.description: Start as per "Roadrunner Excavation Company Left", but use a sloping edge to climb directly up the face above.  Great movement, but difficult to avoid dabbing on the small boulder behind.

problems.name: Roadrunner Excavation Company Left
problems.description: Start on the long, juggy rail beneath the low, obvious roof at the right corner of the west face of the Albatross boulder.  Fierce compression moves and a sloping pinch lead up and left to a dynamic finish.

problems.name: V1
problems.description: Sit-start and climb the blunt prow at the corner of the boulder.

problems.name: Pumpout
problems.description: Start as per "Shutdown", but after the crack section, continue moving up and left to finish up the juggy prow.

problems.name: Shutdown
problems.description: Sit-start on a jug at the lowest end of the diagonal crack in the small cave.  Climb the juggy crack to a sloping and powerful topout.  Great movement!

problems.name: Overtime
problems.description: Start as per "Shutdown", but move directly right using a series of incut slots and edges.  At the long incut edge, a big move upward to a jug leads to easier climbing.  Finish either back left on a positive ledge, or move right, up a series of horns and jugs.  Excellent warm-up with fun movement!  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Pomme D'api
problems.description: Start, and climb, as per "The Rose Road", but continue left.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2016)

problems.name: The Rose Road
problems.description: Start as per "Forbidden Fruit", but head left, then up, through a mail-slot hold, and over the bulge.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2016)

problems.name: Forbidden Fruit
problems.description: Sit-start, using obvious, low left-hand edge, and right-hand sidepull.  Climb up and right.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2016)

problems.name: Crimp Pimp
problems.description: Sit-start using low crimps.  Climb up and left.  (FA Mark Guckert, 2016)

problems.name: Little Green Sprout
problems.description: (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Jolly Green Giant
problems.description: Quest up the middle of the giant slab.  Juggy ledges lead to a small overlap, which is your last chance to downclimb.  Otherwise, high-step and commit to the finish.  Don't fall.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Trent's Other Slab
problems.description: V0/1X.  Climb the slab directly through the corner and overlap feature.  (FA Trent Hoover 2016)

problems.name: Pomme D'api
problems.description: Start, and climb, as per "The Rose Road", but continue left.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2016)

problems.name: The Rose Road
problems.description: Start as per "Forbidden Fruit", but head left, then up, through a mail-slot hold, and over the bulge.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2016)

problems.name: Forbidden Fruit
problems.description: Sit-start, using obvious, low left-hand edge, and right-hand sidepull.  Climb up and right.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2016)

problems.name: Crimp Pimp
problems.description: Sit-start using low crimps.  Climb up and left.  (FA Mark Guckert, 2016)

problems.name: Man in the Box
problems.description: V6.  Stand-start using obvious left-hand jug.  Move up and left, towards a flat jug on the lip/arete.  Roll left to top out.

problems.name: The Road Not Taken
problems.description: Stand-start.  Climb the obvious right-trending rail/shelf system, eventually gaining the lip on your left.  A few more moves will gain the slab and top-out.

problems.name: Before I Sleep
problems.description: V4X.  Stand-start near "The Road Not Taken", and climb directly up and right to gain the crack and finish of "Do Not Go Gentle".  Crux is tenuous and sequential, with a dynamic sideways move, and occurs at 5+ meters.

problems.name: Into the Void
problems.description: V5/6 X. Step off rock to gain huge, flat right-hand undercling pinch. Move up and right, through several long, tenuous, and serious moves through the clean face, eventually gaining the large crack. Top-out directly through the peak.

problems.name: Do Not Go Gentle
problems.description: V3X.  Stand-start just right of centre, using a high, right-hand jug-edge.  Head up and slightly right through good edges, before heading left to a juggy crack.  Continue up, topping out directly through the peak.

problems.name: The Will
problems.description: V9.  Sit-start just right of black-stained alcove, using a right-hand gaston edge, and anything workable for your left.  Pull on and reach left for a small-but-good crimp in grey rock, then push right to join "If".

problems.name: If
problems.description: Stand-start with vertical, one-pad pinch for right-hand, and a small sidepull or undercling near the same height for your left.  Head up and right, to obvious sloper feature, then way up and right to incut rail.  Top out as per "Where the Sidewalk Ends".

problems.name: Where the Sidewalk Ends
problems.description: Sit-start under arete, using a good right-hand edge on arete, and anything lower for left-hand.  Climb the left side of the angling arete.  Head right to top out.

problems.name: Paleofit
problems.description: Kind of an eliminate, to keep the grade honest.  Start way low and left (out of the picture) and happily slap your way rightwards along the low lip (there is a key hold under the roof as well) to top out at basically the same spot as "Trent's Cave".  Lots of great eliminates and variations here, too!  (FA Terry Paholek, 2013)

problems.name: Trent's Cave
problems.description: A classic on a rare treat in Frank: multiple moves on positive holds in a steep roof!  Start way down in the cave on a juggy undercling/sidepull down and right of the lower end of the rail/crack.  Follow the incut rail out of the cave.  A number of fun eliminates and variations can be done, as well.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Trent's Rave
problems.description: Start on "Trent's Cave." After the first 2 moves head up and right to a slopey edge and again to the peak of the boulder.  The juggy slot at the top of the rail on "Trent's Cave" is out.

problems.name: Cognitive Dissonance
problems.description: Stand-start matched on huge, left-facing sloper undercling.  A couple of BURLY(!) moves on decent, but awkwardly positioned, edges lead to a dynamic crux and a harder-than-it-looks topout.  (FA Morgan Dunnet, 2014)

problems.name: The Shield
problems.description: A masterpiece!  Start on two perfect, opposing sidepulls at around chest-height (the left is lower and more incut).  Power straight up through the shield feature with simple-but-precise compression moves on perfect edges and miserable feet.  Top out is relatively easy, but airy and not a gimme.

problems.name: The Chosen Few
problems.description: V3.  A bit of a forced line, as it is possible to press up and right and climb the slab at any time.  Sit-start at base of overhanging arete, using obvious, low rail for right-hand, and a left-hand undercling edge in the overhang. Climb the line of holds just right of the arete, following it to top-out at the peak.

problems.name: The Chosen Few
problems.description: V3.  A bit of a forced line, as it is possible to press up and right and climb the slab at any time.  Sit-start at base of overhanging arete, using obvious, low rail for right-hand, and a left-hand undercling edge in the overhang. Climb the line of holds just right of the arete, following it to top-out at the peak.

problems.name: The Forgotten Many
problems.description: V1.  Start as per "The Chosen Few".  Roll onto the slab as soon as possible, then continue up and right, to top out the slab.

problems.name: The Hoover Effect
problems.description: Stand-start at middle of face, using some edges above cave.  Climb boldy up the increasingly difficult slab.

problems.name: The Dunnet Method
problems.description: Stand-start off of boulder under the left side of the arete, grabbing two left-facing edges.  Climb up and right, around the arete, joining the top-out of "The Derksen Factor".

problems.name: The Derksen Factor
problems.description: Start off small boulder, using left-hand mini-horn/beak, and good right-hand edge nearby.  Head up and left through sloping edges/pinches, eventually rocking up into the corner/scoop feature.

problems.name: Marco's Law
problems.description: Start low on blocky rail.  Climb direct up face above, through flat jugs to start, then a tricky middle, tenuous crux gaining incut rail just below lip, and a no-gimme top-out.

problems.name: Breaking the Law
problems.description: Start as per "Marco's Law", but continue along the obvious blocky rail system, eventually joining the top of " Solar Power".

problems.name: The Erickson Variable
problems.description: Start on edges above large, blocky rail (or lower, as per "Marco's Law").  Head up and left to gain a tricky crux at the top of the face.

problems.name: Solar Power
problems.description: Stand-start using juggy left-hand sidpull, and good, slightly higher rail for your right.  Head straight up the tall face.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: Death in the Afternoon
problems.description: V3/4. Either stand or sit-start at the left-facing corner. Gain a hold in the crack above, then reach up and right to a sidepull in the face.  Continue up and right to top out. Technical and committing above the pit landing.

problems.name: Solar Power
problems.description: Stand-start using juggy left-hand sidpull, and good, slightly higher rail for your right.  Head straight up the tall face.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: Death in the Afternoon
problems.description: V3/4. Either stand or sit-start at the left-facing corner. Gain a hold in the crack above, then reach up and right to a sidepull in the face.  Continue up and right to top out. Technical and committing above the pit landing.

problems.name: Sea of Slaughter
problems.description: V5.  Sit-start with left-hand on gaston/pinch, and right-hand lower on arete.  Climb directly up the left side of the arete.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2016)

problems.name: No Country For Old Men
problems.description: V2.  Stand-start with left-hand sidepull/undercling, and right-hand lower on arete.  Move up and right, gaining holds for both hands around the arete, then back left along the lip to top out.  (FA Dan Anhorn, 2016)

problems.name: Mindcraft
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start low in pit, with large, crescent shaped right-hand sidepull, and left-hand on arete.  Climb directly up.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2014)

problems.name: The Whole Little Song and Dance
problems.description: Sit-start at base of arete, left-hand on sidepull crimp left of the arete, right-hand on a good-but-hidden sidepull/undercling far and low right in the overhang.  Climb the right side of the arete.

problems.name: The Danimal's Den
problems.description: V4/5 Sit-start with left-hand on large, slopey sidepull/pinch, and right-hand on a good, somewhat hidden undercling edge (close to the rock on your right).  Head right, out of the cave, finishing up the right side of the arete.

problems.name: Vitruvian Dan
problems.description: V3. Start as per "Danimal's Den", but climb up and left.  (FA Dan Anhorn, 2014)

problems.name: Ocarina
problems.description: V1.  Climb the left side of the arete.  (FA Kyle Marco, 2016)

problems.name: Twilight
problems.description: Sit-start using left-hand sloper on arete, and small right-hand edge on the face.  Climb the right side of the arete.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2016)

problems.name: Skyward Sword
problems.description: V5/6.  Eliminate.  Start as per "Wind Waker", and climb the face direct, without use of any arete holds.  (FA Kyle Marco, 2016)

problems.name: Wind Waker
problems.description: V4,  Sit-start, matched on horizontal rail.  Move up and right, to gain arete feature, and use this to climb up and left to the flat lip.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2016)

problems.name: Wind Temple
problems.description: V2.  Start, and climb, as per "Wind Waker".  Once you gain the arete, mantle onto the shelf on your right, and top out up the bulge.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2016)

problems.name: Maniac Magee
problems.description: Start matched on flat jug at far left end of lip.  Make a few moves up and right along the lip, until you can press up to a couple of incut edges higher on the slab.  Finish up the easy, but VERY tall, slab.

problems.name: Maniac Magee ext.
problems.description: Start as per "Maniac Magee", but follow the lip right, to a dynamic crux gaining a good hold on the arete.  From here, press up onto the slab, finishing up just left of the arete.

problems.name: Chi Sao
problems.description: Sit-start matched on low feature with right-hand edge and left-hand sidepull.  Head up and right, through pinch and sloper, to join the top of "Kiai".

problems.name: Chi Sao left
problems.description: Start as per "Chi Sao", but cross right-hand up to pinch, and continue up and left.

problems.name: Kiai stand
problems.description: Stand-start using obvious, high left-hand sloper, and right-hand anywhere lower.  Move up and left at first, then back right slightly to top out.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2016)

problems.name: Kiai
problems.description: Sit-start using two crimps just left of the arete.  Head up and left, using the arete/lip on your right, and a large, triangular sloper on your left, topping out directly from there.

problems.name: Unbreakable
problems.description: V6.  Sit-start using right-hand slot in small cave, and anything lower for left.  Climb up and left, to the dihedral and arete.

problems.name: Force of Will
problems.description: V5.  Start as per "Unbreakable", but head directly up.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2016)

problems.name: The Opposite of Walking
problems.description: V3.  Start with left-hand sidepull/undercling edge, and right-hand somewhere lower.  Climb direct.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: The Littlest Hobo
problems.description: Sit-start using low jug.  Climb diagonally up and left.

problems.name: Hobo Safety Meat
problems.description: V2/3.  Start as per "The Littlest Hobo", but climb up and right.

problems.name: Casper
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start using obvious left-hand sidepull, and incut crimp/edge for right-hand.  Climb up and left, away from the arete, to the peak of the slab.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: Richie Rich
problems.description: V1.  Start as per "Casper".  Head up and right, joining the arete at mid-height.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: Swanglish
problems.description: V3.  Sit-start under far left end of low roof, with left-hand on large sidepull/corner feature, and right-hand on anything lower and useful in roof.  Climb awkwardly up and right.

problems.name: Swinglish
problems.description: Sit-start under roof, using good left-hand pinch, and anything else under the roof for your right.  Head right, to jugs on the lip, and up the face above.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Super Swinglish
problems.description: V3.  Sit-start low and right, outside cave, using a pair of good lip edges.  Traverse left, along lip jugs, all the way to arete.  Gain edges around arete, and continue up and left to top out.  Start as per "Swinglish" for variation at the same grade.

problems.name: Flexion
problems.description: V5. Sit-start matched on jug in crack.  Head up and left through edges to gain juggier holds on the right side of a scoop, and top out.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: Flexion Direct
problems.description: V5. Sit-start as per "Flexion".  After the long move away from the crack and into edges out left, tackle the bulge directly using more edges.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: Extension Extension
problems.description: V6. Sit-start, matched on large shelf at the bottom right end of the lip.  Head left to gain holds in the crack, then continue along edges to gain the right side of a scoop in the lip.  Continue traversing left to gain the peak of the lip, and top-out.

problems.name: The High Road
problems.description: Sit-start matched on lowest sloping edge on the left side of the face above the roof.  Use foot magic to gain more sloping edges and the slab above.  (FA Kyle Marco)

problems.name: El Sendero Tortuoso
problems.description: Sit-start matched on large, right-facing vertical rail.  Tricky footwork and sloping edges lead up onto the slab.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: The Low Road
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start matched on long, low rail.  Climb up and left.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2016)

problems.name: The Low Road Low
problems.description: V3.  Start on an edge and a crimp in the cave, climbing up and into "The Low Road".  (FA Trent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: Makeathat
problems.description: V3.  Sit-start in small alcove, using a good, obvious right-hand edge near adjacent boulder.  Move up and left, joining "The Low Road".

problems.name: Makeathat direct
problems.description: V3.  Sit-start as per "Makeathat", but head directly up arête above.

problems.name: Lost in the Dream
problems.description: V5.  Sit-start matched on large, left-facing edge,  Move up and right.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2016)

problems.name: The Giver
problems.description: V3.  Sit-start at far right end of short overhang/bulge (farther right than photo shows), matched on lowest slopey lip edges.  Move up and slightly left on tricky edges.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2017)

problems.name: Six Stars
problems.description: V1. Start by stepping onto boulder at left-trending seam.  Head up and right to gain arete, and top out.

problems.name: Welcome to Turpinchistan
problems.description: V6. Sit-start using large edge.  Climb the left side of the arete.

problems.name: Crimpistan
problems.description: V3. Start as per "Turpinchistan", but move into edges out right.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: Freezer Full of Rotten Meat
problems.description: On a little boulder facing the uphill side of "The Giant" boulder.  Sit-start on two large edges below the lip on the left side of the boulder.  Move up to the lip, then rightwards on slopers, a sharp crack-jug, and a crimp or two.  Trickier than it looks!

problems.name: Evan's Seven
problems.description: Sit-start matched on left-facing edge.  Move up and left to a cool, mini-blob pinch.  Continue up (and slightly right) to the peak of the boulder using edges and slopers.  Top out the right side of the peak.  (FA Evan Erickson)

problems.name: Echo Echo
problems.description: Sit-start matched on a right-facing sidepull on the left side of the face. Reach up and left to an edge and a fun lip encounter.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: Flying Fox
problems.description: Sit-start using mini-jug.  Climb up and slightly left on crimps to gain a good edge high on the face.  From here, exit directly above via hidden, sloping dishes, or reach/jump to a jug far out left.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: Energy Returned over Energy Invested
problems.description: Sit-start using the same start hold as "Flying Fox". After the first crimp on that problem, head up and sharply right via a sidepull and little undercling.  Using either the lip/arete up and right, or a long reach off the undercling, gain a face jug, the horn on the lip, and tricky mantle to finish.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: Darkness Falls
problems.description: Sit-start using the long edge on the right side of the boulder. Reach left to the prominent sidepull, then head up to the prominent notch in the lip above. With difficulty, use this to gain the good sidepull in the corner above. Topout by highstepping and rolling onto the slab. WAY harder than it looks.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: Tall Club
problems.description: With a hand low on each arete, compressing the boulder, sit-start the face the climber in the picture is looking at.  Slap your right hand along the arete/lip until you can gain a couple of cool jugs at the peak of the overhanging face.  A tricky topout with a bad landing awaits.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2014)

problems.name: The Left Hand of Darkness
problems.description: Sit-start matched on sloping shelf (use any edges on the shelf).  Pull to an edge above you, then rockover to a small sidepull way out left.  Top out direct.

problems.name: The Right Hand of Darkness
problems.description: Sit-start as per "The Left Hand of Darkness", but head up and right, through small edges and crimps.

problems.name: Jumping Jurrassic Fat
problems.description: V0. Sit start near middle- right of face, on obvious crimp features. Ascend direct to slope-y mantle over karst.

problems.name: Justin's Jeté
problems.description: V2. Sit start under arete-ish feature, left of true arete. Left hand on incut crimp, right hand on slopey pinch. Traverse left through obvious line of sloping crimps, staying below the line of karst-y jugs above, all the way uphill,to turn the arete. (FA: Dan Anhorn, Trent Hoover & Kyle Marco, 2017)

problems.name: Monkey Wrench
problems.description: V3. Sit start just left of arete, left hand low on incut side pull, right hand high on back pulling jug/pinch. Move up onto the slab to meet up with Dimetrodon's finish. (FA: Dan Anhorn & Trent Hoover, 2017).

problems.name: Monkey Wrench
problems.description: V3. Sit start just left of arete, left hand low on incut side pull, right hand high on back pulling jug/pinch. Move up onto the slab to meet up with Dimetrodon's finish. (FA: Dan Anhorn & Trent Hoover, 2017).

problems.name: Dimetrodon
problems.description: V1. Sit start in hidden pit, left hand on one of two slopey jugs, right hand on hidden undercling. Tension up big holds to avoid dabbing the pit walls, through the dihedral, to a fun feature to top out.

problems.name: The Gallows
problems.description: Use slab of lower boulder to get established on overhanging arete of upper boulder.  Around mid-height, move left to gain sloper feature in face, then continue up and left to top-out precariously in middle of lip.  Very committing.

problems.name: The Gallows
problems.description: Use slab of lower boulder to get established on overhanging arete of upper boulder.  Around mid-height, move left to gain sloper feature in face, then continue up and left to top-out precariously in middle of lip.  Very committing.

problems.name: Supa Scoopa
problems.description: V5. Sit-start with hands just above lip of cave (right-hand edge and left-hand gaston).  Make a big move up and left, to a flat jug.  Match, and continue up. Watch for loose rock up high.

problems.name: Supa Scoopa extension
problems.description: Climb "Supa Scoopa" to the flat jug, then continue left, around the arete, into exposed territory.

problems.name: Mighty Scoop
problems.description: V5/6. Sit-start with lowest pinch/edge on arete for left-hand, and very low right-hand sidepull edge.  Cross right-hand up to higher arete hold, and continue up and left.

problems.name: Mighty Scoop low
problems.description: V8.  Start matched on huge undercling jug under low roof.  Move up into "Mighty Scoop".

problems.name: Supa Scoopa low
problems.description: V8/9.  Start, and climb, as per "Mighty Scoop low", but continue left along the lip of the cave, into the start of "Supa Scoopa".  Finish up either "Supa Scoopa" or its extension.

problems.name: Mighty Scoop right
problems.description: Start as per "Mighty Scoop", but move up and right, climbing the right side of the arete.

problems.name: Supa Scoopa
problems.description: V5. Sit-start with hands just above lip of cave (right-hand edge and left-hand gaston).  Make a big move up and left, to a flat jug.  Match, and continue up. Watch for loose rock up high.

problems.name: Claustrophobia
problems.description: V8.  Sit-start using obvious right-hand edge, and anything lower for left-hand.  Move up and slightly left to exit cave.

problems.name: The Pit and the Pendulum
problems.description: Start using obvious large shelf (and any surrounding edges) at downhill entrance to tunnel.  Make a big move to a good right-hand edge in the roof, then use some hidden holds up and left to gain a fun exit through the uphill tunnel opening.

problems.name: Brighter Than Creation's Dark
problems.description: V6/7.  Crouch-start at entrance to tunnel, with high right-hand jug just outside tunnel, and anything lower for left-hand.  Traverse left, over the pit, before heading up, to a tricky exit at the uphill opening of the tunnel.

problems.name: Cocoon
problems.description: V8.  In the pit to the right of the lower entrance to "Pit and the Pendulum" is a very blunt, hanging prow (facing towards "Firebird").  Start with right-hand on juggy sidepull edge (back in narrow gap between boulders), and left-hand on a low sloper.  Climb the prow to the lip, traversing left to top out.

problems.name: The Land of Wind and Ghosts
problems.description: V7/8. Basically a reversal of "Brighter Than Creation's Dark". Start in the tunnel, using lowest obvious holds above the left side of the pit (a left-hand sloper and a lower, slopey right-hand edge) . Move up and right to a pair of slick edges, then continue right, exiting the tunnel and topping out in the same place as 'Cocoon'. Very unique line - tensiony, technical, and fingery on slick rock.

problems.name: Brighter Than Creation's Dark
problems.description: V6/7.  Crouch-start at entrance to tunnel, with high right-hand jug just outside tunnel, and anything lower for left-hand.  Traverse left, over the pit, before heading up, to a tricky exit at the uphill opening of the tunnel.

problems.name: The Pit and the Pendulum
problems.description: Start using obvious large shelf (and any surrounding edges) at downhill entrance to tunnel.  Make a big move to a good right-hand edge in the roof, then use some hidden holds up and left to gain a fun exit through the uphill tunnel opening.

problems.name: The Pit and the Pendulum
problems.description: Start using obvious large shelf (and any surrounding edges) at downhill entrance to tunnel.  Make a big move to a good right-hand edge in the roof, then use some hidden holds up and left to gain a fun exit through the uphill tunnel opening.

problems.name: Jolly Green Giant
problems.description: **for full view and details, access the "Jolly Green Giant" boulder (under the City of Giants sector) on the left navigation sidebar.

problems.name: Trench Warfare
problems.description: Start low in pit, underclinging bottom of suspended boulder, with your feet on the back-wall formed by a smaller block.  Head up through rails/edges to gain a tricky topout.

problems.name: Firebird
problems.description: Sit-start, matched low on the lip.  Head up through edges and crimps, finishing up slab.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2016)

problems.name: Cocoon
problems.description: V8.  In the pit to the right of the lower entrance to "Pit and the Pendulum" is a very blunt, hanging prow (facing towards "Firebird").  Start with right-hand on juggy sidepull edge (back in narrow gap between boulders), and left-hand on a low sloper.  Climb the prow to the lip, traversing left to top out.

problems.name: The Pit and the Pendulum
problems.description: Start using obvious large shelf (and any surrounding edges) at downhill entrance to tunnel.  Make a big move to a good right-hand edge in the roof, then use some hidden holds up and left to gain a fun exit through the uphill tunnel opening.

problems.name: Firebird
problems.description: Sit-start, matched low on the lip.  Head up through edges and crimps, finishing up slab.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2016)

problems.name: The Dark Arts
problems.description: V4ish.  Sit-start in cave using obvious, positive right-hand edge and opposing left-hand edge.  Make a big move to the lip of the cave, match, and continue left for a tricky exit.

problems.name: Trench Warfare
problems.description: Start low in pit, underclinging bottom of suspended boulder, with your feet on the back-wall formed by a smaller block.  Head up through rails/edges to gain a tricky topout.

problems.name: Wind Shadow
problems.description: V3. Stand-start matched at low, left end of lip. Traverse lip up and right, topping out at the peak. (FA Trent Hoover, 2019)

problems.name: I'll Cast a Shadow
problems.description: V8/9. Sit-start as per "Wind Shadow low". After the first move, traverse right, through a tricky edge/crimp sequence, to finish on "Shadow of Doubt".

problems.name: Wind Shadow low
problems.description: V4. Sit-start at left side of face, using right-hand sidepull crimp, and left-hand gaston or sidepull. Move up and left to join the stand-start. (FA Trent Hoover, 2019)

problems.name: Shadow of a Mans
problems.description: V6. Sit-start using very low opposing sidepull crimps. Climb more or less directly up to the peak. (FA Mark Derksen, 2019)

problems.name: Shadow of a Doubt
problems.description: V6/7. Stand-start at good chest-height edges in the middle of "Shadow of a Mans".  Make a tricky dyno up and right to the lip on "Two O'Clock Shadow" and finish up that line.

problems.name: Shadowy Men on a Shadowy Planet
problems.description: V6/7. Crouch-start using good right-hand sidepull edge, and anything lower for your left. Move left to a good edge, followed by tensiony moves to gain the lip up and right. Move left to top out.

problems.name: Two O'Clock Shadow
problems.description: V4. Stand-start matched on hold complex just below far right end of lip. Move up to lip, then traverse up and left, topping out at peak. (FA Trent Hoover, 2019)

problems.name: Teapot Prow stand
problems.description: V3/4. Stand-start using a good left-hand sidepull, and a small right-hand edge. One move gains the lip and topout.  Caution is needed on the topout, as there are some large, loose blocks that wouldn't come off while cleaning, but are highly suspect.

problems.name: The Teacup
problems.description: V5/6. Sit-start using obvious juggy edges in the cave. Move up and left to slopers/pinches, and continue up and left through juggy edges to top out.

problems.name: English Breakfast
problems.description: V0. Sit-start at base of arete, using obvious right-hand edge low on the face, and good left-hand edge just left of the arete. Pull on, make a couple of moves, and roll left onto the slab when you can.

problems.name: Second Cup
problems.description: V1. Start as per "English Breakfast", but continue up and right, along the arete, until gaining the lip and topping out.

problems.name: The Teapot
problems.description: V10ish. Start using a large, smooth right-hand sidepull/undercling, and anything same height or lower for your left-hand. Move up and left through a left-hand notch and another right-hand sidepull/undercling to gain the lip and topout. (FA Scott Eveleigh, 2019)

problems.name: Scott's Crimp Problem
problems.description: V7ish. Sit-start using low cluster of crimps/edges. Move up and slightly right through tricky/tensiony crimping. (FA Scott Eveleigh, 2019)

problems.name: Teapot Prow stand
problems.description: V3/4. Stand-start using a good left-hand sidepull, and a small right-hand edge. One move gains the lip and topout.  Caution is needed on the topout, as there are some large, loose blocks that wouldn't come off while cleaning, but are highly suspect.

problems.name: Short and Stout
problems.description: V7ish.  SIt-start using low cluster of crimps/edges. Move up and left.

problems.name: At First Light
problems.description: V3. Sit-start using left-hand crimp on arete, and right-hand pinch just above you.  Head up and left, along arete, and onto exposed slab above. (FA Dan Anhorn, 2016)

problems.name: Dawn Patrol
problems.description: V2. Sit-start as per "At First Light".  Move up and right through good holds.  (FA Dan Anhorn, 2016)

problems.name: Krankenstein Left
problems.description: V5.  Start as per "Krankenstein", but head up and left.

problems.name: Krankenstein
problems.description: V4/5.  Sit-start with good left undercling rail, and opposing right-hand rail/edge.  Climb up and right.  (FA Kyle Marco)

problems.name: Whole Lotta Krankin'
problems.description: V6/7.  Start as per "Krank It Out",  Move up, then traverse low and left, linking all the way into "Krankenstein Left".

problems.name: Keep Krankin'
problems.description: V5/6.  Start as per "Krank It Out".  Climb up and left into "Krankenstein".

problems.name: Krank It Out
problems.description: V5/6.  Sit-start in pit at base of arete, using high left-hand sidepull edge (1m left of arete), and low, sharp sidepull crimp to the right of the arete.  Climb direct up the arete.

problems.name: Still Krankin"
problems.description: V5.  Start as per "Krank It Out".  Climb up and right, towards "Crankin' Time".

problems.name: Crankin' Time
problems.description: V3.  Sit-start with incut edge for left-hand, and low micro-crimp for right.  Move up and left.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: King Cobra
problems.description: Stand-start with high right-hand pinch (to the right of the arete), and left-hand underclinging the blunt lip of the boulder (down and left).  Climb the left side of the lower arete, then directly up the bulge above.  Head right to top out.

problems.name: Sidewinder
problems.description: V6. Start at obvious smooth jug on the face.  Head up and left to the arete.  Climb the right side of the arete, to airy top-out.

problems.name: Boa
problems.description: V8.  Start as per "Sidewinder", and traverse low around arete, joining "King Cobra" at its first move, and finishing up that problem.

problems.name: Anaconda
problems.description: V4. Somewhere on far right side of boulder. Start with left-hand on a weird notched sloper, and right-hand on a very slopey horizontal edge. Move right to a sidepull, and up. (FA Evan Erickson, 2017)

problems.name: Sweep the Leg
problems.description: Stand-start right of the dab bloc, matched on high, flat jug.  Head up and left to arete.  Climb right side of arete, to rubbly top-out.

problems.name: Spitting Cobra
problems.description: V6/7.  Start as per "King Cobra".  After the first move, continue left using tricky edges and feet, and finish up the left arete.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2018)

problems.name: King Cobra
problems.description: Stand-start with high right-hand pinch (to the right of the arete), and left-hand underclinging the blunt lip of the boulder (down and left).  Climb the left side of the lower arete, then directly up the bulge above.  Head right to top out.

problems.name: Boa
problems.description: V8.  Start as per "Sidewinder", and traverse low around arete, joining "King Cobra" at its first move, and finishing up that problem.

problems.name: The Snake Charmer
problems.description: V9/10. Start, and climb, as per "Boa", but continue left into "Spitting Cobra".

problems.name: Sidewinder
problems.description: V6. Start at obvious smooth jug on the face.  Head up and left to the arete.  Climb the right side of the arete, to airy top-out.

problems.name: Time Stands Still
problems.description: V0.  Start under peak of slab, by stepping onto massive foot-hold.  Climb direct, gaining the lip just right of the peak.

problems.name: The March of Time
problems.description: Sit-start in the pit, right hand on an obvious incut sidepull in the overhang, left hand on a higher blocky pinch to the left.  Throw to the very sloping lip, then continue rightwards along the lip.  Finish up the right side of the arete.

problems.name: Savoureux
problems.description: Sit-start with right hand edge in a crack in the overhang, and left hand on a good edge on the lip of the boulder.  Bust right to the arete.  Finish up the right side of the arete.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2014)

problems.name: Moonrise Kingdom
problems.description: Eliminate.  Climb the slab, without using the aretes.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2014)

problems.name: Moonrise Arete
problems.description: V0. Climb the slab using the right arete. (FA, ?)

problems.name: Commodore 64
problems.description: Sit-start in the pit at the base of the left arete.  Climb the right side of the leaning arete.  (FA Adam Currie)

problems.name: Commodore 64 Extension
problems.description: Sit-start as per "Commodore 64".  Once you snag the lip, traverse right around the blunt nose, and finish up the right side of the boulder.

problems.name: Meat Grinder
problems.description: V3. Climb the roof crack formed by the commodore Boulder and the March of Time Boulder, starting deep in the little cave. (FA, ?)

problems.name: The Price of Gold
problems.description: Face "Commodore 64", and look to your right.  There is a small pit at the base of the larger, adjacent boulder.  Start in this pit, with a small, right-hand edge and a low, left-hand sidepull on the arete.  A compression sequence leads to a shelf.  Top out above.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2014)

problems.name: Adrian's Arete
problems.description: V3. Climb the left side of the airy arete above the scary pit. (FA, ?)

problems.name: Walker
problems.description: Start on obvious jug.  Follow rail up and left.

problems.name: Texas Ranger
problems.description: Start as per "Walker", but head straight up.
Sit-start matched on large, right-facing edge.  Move left to a jug-edge, then right to the long, incut edge above.

problems.name: Quasimodo
problems.description: Jump-start by placing one foot on the slab, and hopping up to catch the incut edge above.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Chuck Norris Versus Tungsten
problems.description: Sit-start using low, blocky edges.  Follow the obvious line of sharp pockets to the lip of the boulder.

problems.name: Bloodsport
problems.description: Start as per "Chuck Norris Versus Tungsten".  After a few moves, reach left to a long, incut edge.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: Quasimodo
problems.description: Jump-start by placing one foot on the slab, and hopping up to catch the incut edge above.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Chuck Norris Versus Tungsten
problems.description: Sit-start using low, blocky edges.  Follow the obvious line of sharp pockets to the lip of the boulder.

problems.name: Bloodsport
problems.description: Start as per "Chuck Norris Versus Tungsten".  After a few moves, reach left to a long, incut edge.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: The Way of the Dragon
problems.description: Sit-start using widely spaced, opposing edges.  Head up and right.

problems.name: Delta Force
problems.description: Sit-start low in pit, using obvious jug.  Climb the right side of the arete.

problems.name: Delta Sandwich
problems.description: Start on Delta Force.  After the first couple of moves traverse left into The Sandwich Rule and finish right of the apex of the boulder (FA Kent Dunham, 2017).

problems.name: The Sandwich Rule
problems.description: Sit-start using blocky right-hand sidepull, and left-hand crimp sidepull.  Move up and right.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

sector: Man of Science, Man of Faith

problems.name: Man of Science
problems.description: V5/6.  Sit-start low and left, matched on shelf.  Follow the prow up and right, using good edges on your left, and some cool holds on the underside of the prow.  Top out to the right of the apex.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2013)

problems.name: Pseuodscience
problems.description: V2.  Start, and climb, as per "Man of Science, Man of Faith", but exit early up jugs.

problems.name: Pseudoscience Low
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start with right-hand sidepull/pinch, and very low left-hand sloper, deep under the roof.  Head up and left into "Pseudoscience".  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: Tesseract
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start using the large undercling notch, and anything lower. Climb the right side of the aesthetic arete.  (FA Trent Hoover & Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Deep Freeze
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start matched on flattish spot low and right on huge sloping rail feature.  Head left along rail, then lip, to the arete, topping out from there.  Nice line on not-so-nice holds and rock.

problems.name: Black Swan
problems.description: V2/3.  Sit-start matched on good edge just right of arete.  Move to arete, then up.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Swan Lake
problems.description: V5.  Sit-start using low edge just right of "Black Swan".  Head up and right.

problems.name: Horseshoes
problems.description: V0/1.  Stand-start with right-hand edge and left-hand sloper, around chest-height.  Climb slab, using the blunt arete to your left.

problems.name: Side Saddle
problems.description: V2.  Stand-start using chest-height edges.  Move up and right, using obvious rail for your left-hand, and some crimps out right.

problems.name: Roundup
problems.description: V6/7.  Sit-start as per "Giddy Up", but push out left immediately, into a tricky crimp/edge sequence, gaining the start holds of "Side Saddle" and finishing up from there.

problems.name: Giddy-Up
problems.description: V6.  Sit-start using small, side-by-side edges low in the middle of the face.  Climb directly up face above.

problems.name: Low Brow Direct
problems.description: V1/2.  Sit-start below the huge rail, left-hand on a sidepull edge, right-hand anywhere lower.  Move up to shelf, then finish as per "Low Brow".

problems.name: High Brow
problems.description: V2.  Start, and climb, as per "Low Brow".  From the end of the huge rail, continue left, using an edge or two to gain another large rail below the lip of the boulder.  Top out directly above.  Another variation (contrived, same grade) uses crimps below the upper rail to gain a jug further left.  (FA Dan Anhorn, 2016)

problems.name: Low Brow
problems.description: V0.  Sit-start matched on right end of huge rail.  Traverse left, to end of rail, then move up to the lip to top out.  (FA Dan Anhorn, 2016)

problems.name: Blink
problems.description: V0.  Start as per "Low Brow", but go directly up.

problems.name: The Thing That Should Not Be
problems.description: V7.  Start as per "Thrash", but use crazy toe-hooking and tension to navigate the underside of the suspended block, and exit the other side of the cave.

problems.name: Thrash
problems.description: V3.  About 50m south-west of main "Sunny D" boulder.  Sit-start under suspended block, left-hand on good, high edge (below lip, near rock on your left), and right-hand on low edge, near bottom-right corner of block.  Thrash up and over the top.  Terrible.

problems.name: The Thing That Should Not Be
problems.description: V7.  Start as per "Thrash", but use crazy toe-hooking and tension to navigate the underside of the suspended block, and exit the other side of the cave.

problems.name: Frictionary Arete
problems.description: Sit-start using low left-hand sidepull jug near arete, and black right-hand edge in overhang.  Climb straight up the arete.

problems.name: Fan-Friction
problems.description: Start as per "Frictionary Arete".  Traverse right to link up with "Frictionary".

problems.name: Non-Friction Story
problems.description: Sit-start as per "Frictionary".  Traverse left to link-up with "Frictionary Arete".  (FA Evan Erickson, 2007)

problems.name: Frictionary
problems.description: Sit-start using low, right-facing flake jug.  Climb straight up through dynamic moves on positive edges.

problems.name: Frictionary Crack
problems.description: Sit-start at base of crack, using horn feature.  Climb the crack.

problems.name: Undertaker
problems.description: This problem starts on an undercling crimp.  Exact description to be updated soon.

problems.name: Undergrad
problems.description: Exact details TBD.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2013)

problems.name: V2
problems.description: Sit-start using low, good holds.  Climb the left end of the face.

problems.name: Underking
problems.description: Sit-start with right-hand on good incut undercling, and left-hand anywhere lower.  Head straight up.

problems.name: Catacomb
problems.description: V9.  Sit-start in cave, using two low, right-facing edges near the bottom of the prow.  Move up to a good left-hand edge, then follow the steep prow out of the cave, finishing up the slab.

problems.name: Black Cherry Soda
problems.description: Sit-start in cave with a good left-hand sidepull.  Head right, out of the cave, to gain a right-trending finger-crack.  Follow this crack to top-out.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2016)

problems.name: Cherry Pepsi
problems.description: Start, and climb, as per "Black Cherry Soda".  Upon gaining the lip at the top of the crack, head back left, finishing on the lip traverse.  (FA Kyle Marco, 2016)

problems.name: Kyle's Lip Traverse
problems.description: Sit-start at far right end of boulder, using a good left-hand sidepull.  Climb along the rising lip, topping out at the upper left end.  (FA Kyle Marco, 2016)

problems.name: Partial Justice
problems.description: V2ish.  Sit-start, matched on huge flat edge.  Move right and up, to join "Swift Justice".  Nice moves on comfy edges and slopers.  Can also be climbed more directly up, but on less enjoyable holds.  (FA Kyle Marco)

problems.name: Swift Justice
problems.description: V7ish.  Sit-start in cave using a decent right-hand undercling  edge, and a slopey left-hand sidepull edge.  A hard first move to a good rail outside the cave leads to a fun and easy top out on nicely sculpted holds.

problems.name: Constellation
problems.description: V9.  Sit-start using decent left-hand sidepull edge, and anything lower for right-hand.  Move up and left to gain high, sharp, juggy rail, then continue left to gain arete.  Roll around arete and walk up slab to finish.

problems.name: Apollo 11
problems.description: Stand-start using obvious, juggy edge feature.  Head straight up, using a triangular left-hand pinch to set up for a wild move to the lip.  Traverse slightly left to an easy, but airy(!), mantle.

problems.name: Ptarmigan
problems.description: V3. Sit-start in cave, using left-facing jug flakes. Move up and left to arete and topout. (FA Mark Derksen, 2019)

problems.name: Ptarmigan right
problems.description: V3ish. Sit-start as per "Ptarmigan", but head to the lip up and right, topping out to the right of the peak.

problems.name: Number Two Arete
problems.description: V5.  Sit-start, matched low on arete/lip.  Follow lip, and holds slightly above it, up and left.

problems.name: Brown Arete
problems.description: V5.  Start matched on a good left-facing edge on lip.  Traverse lip up and right, topping out at the peak.  (FA Evan Erickson)

problems.name: Braveheart
problems.description: V2.  Start with left-hand pocket and right-hand edge.  Climb up towards the peak of the boulder, topping out just to its right.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2016)

problems.name: William Wallace
problems.description: Start up "Braveheart", but veer left at mid-height, topping out around the arete.  (FA Kyle Marco, 2016)

problems.name: Mad Max
problems.description: V0.  Climb directly up the middle of the slab.  (FA Kyle Marco, 2016)

problems.name: Max Rockatansky
problems.description: V1.  Start with good right-hand edge and low, sharp left-hand undercling.  Climb directly up bulging slab.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2016)

problems.name: Apocalypto
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start using small, good edges low on arete.  Climb the short arete.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2016)

problems.name: Diamonds are Forever
problems.description: V3. Sit start on right facing rail. Climb and stay right of arete to topout. Watch for loose rock. (FA , 2016)

problems.name: The Eden of Coronet
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start matched on low jug.  Press up and right to thin pinch/crimp for your right-hand, then climb the face directly, gaining the lip just right of the peak.  Tread carefully up high!

problems.name: Maverick
problems.description: V5.  Sit-start, matched on good left-facing rail.  Climb the left side of the arete, to the lip, then traverse left, along lip, to topout.

problems.name: Jaws
problems.description: V4. Sit-start with left hand on long positive edge under small roof, and right-hand on undercling or sidepull at same height.  Climb up blunt arete/prow feature. (FA Trent Hoover, 2016)

problems.name: Diamonds are Forever
problems.description: V3. Sit start on right facing rail. Climb and stay right of arete to topout. Watch for loose rock. (FA , 2016)

problems.name: The Eden of Coronet
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start matched on low jug.  Press up and right to thin pinch/crimp for your right-hand, then climb the face directly, gaining the lip just right of the peak.  Tread carefully up high!

problems.name: Maverick
problems.description: V5.  Sit-start, matched on good left-facing rail.  Climb the left side of the arete, to the lip, then traverse left, along lip, to topout.

problems.name: A Fine Balance
problems.description: V3/4.  Start matched on juggy "fin" undercling.  Move up and left, to arete, then continue up the right side of the arete.  Crux at the top.

problems.name: A Calculated Risk
problems.description: V6.  Sit-start as per "A Fine Balance", but head directly up face above.

problems.name: A Simple Proposition
problems.description: V3.  Crouch or sit-start using a low right-hand finger-jug.  Climb directly up the short face above.

problems.name: A Fine Balance
problems.description: V3/4.  Start matched on juggy "fin" undercling.  Move up and left, to arete, then continue up the right side of the arete.  Crux at the top.

problems.name: A Calculated Risk
problems.description: V6.  Sit-start as per "A Fine Balance", but head directly up face above.

problems.name: A Simple Proposition
problems.description: V3.  Crouch or sit-start using a low right-hand finger-jug.  Climb directly up the short face above.

problems.name: Racing the Storm
problems.description: V5. Sit-start low in left side of cave. Left hand on sidepull, right hand on slopey crimp. Head directly up.  (FA Kyle Marco, 2016)

problems.name: Racing the Sun
problems.description: V7/8.  Sit-start using two triangular, sloping edges. Climb up and right. Tensiony and friction-dependent.

problems.name: Mark of the Beast
problems.description: V8/9.  Crouch-start using low left-hand edge, and a crimpy right-hand pinch (right-foot will be on the obvious fin, higher than your hands).  Climb up and left, out of the cave.

problems.name: Mark of the Beast direct
problems.description: V7.  Start, and climb, as per "Mark of the Beast", but exit the cave directly.

problems.name: Superbeast
problems.description: V7/8.  Crouch-start matched on large fin-jug.  Move up and right, out of cave and up tall face right of arete.

problems.name: Belly of the Beast
problems.description: V2/3.  Pull on using two good slopers just above the lip of the overhang (the left-hand is slightly lower than the right).  Climb the tall face above, trending slightly left.

problems.name: Tomb with a View
problems.description: V0.  Step onto the slab using a couple of obvious edges, just above the lip.  Climb up and left, to the peak of the smooth slab.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2016)

problems.name: The Regift
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start using sharp right-hand sidepull, and small, flat edge for left.  Move left, to toothy jug, then up to lip, and flat jugs to top out.  (FA Kyle Marco, 2016)

problems.name: C.Monster
problems.description: V6. Start as per Blessings in Disguise, instead head out roof to right, finish as per Black Slot Arete. (FA Mark Derksen, 2016)

problems.name: Blessings in Disguise
problems.description: V8.  Sit-start matched on a large, black edge under the roof.  Burly moves lead to a toothy pocket, and a good edge at the end of a sloping shelf.  A couple of powerful options can be used to gain the lip.

problems.name: Black Slot Arete
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start with right-hand on edge around arete, and left-hand on good incut.  Climb the left side of the leaning arete.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2016)

problems.name: The Oozing
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start as per "Black Slot Arete", but traverse immediately right, turning onto the slab with difficulty.  Climb up the slab to an easy topout.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2016)

problems.name: Puffy Neck Warmer
problems.description: V3.  Sit-start with right-hand on good pinch around the arete, and left-hand on thin edge.  Use slopers and sidepulls to gain an airy high-step to top out. (FA Trent Hoover,  2015)

problems.name: Broken Dishes
problems.description: V3. On same boulder as "Puffy Neck Warmer", just south of Mark of the Beast.  Climb the overhung, yellow arete on the left side of the corridor, north of Golden Gait Boulder, from low right-hand crimp and left-hand pinch on arete.  Watch for loose rock.

problems.name: Golden Gait
problems.description: V0.  Step onto slab in middle of yellow face, and use good incuts and rails to gain easy topout over a good landing. Crumbly rock detracts from an otherwise good, easy problem.  (FA Dan Anhorn, 2016)

problems.name: Yellow Plates
problems.description: V0.  Step onto slab, and use right-hand arete and good incuts and rails to top out.  Watch for crumbly rock. (FA Dan Anhorn, 2016)

problems.name: Xenophobe
problems.description: V1. Stand start on 8-inch long edge a few feet to the left of Purity Law. Climb directly up using trickery, avoiding the juggy holds on Purity Law. (FA Trent Hoover, 2017.)

problems.name: Purity Law
problems.description: V0/1. Stand start with one hand in two-finger pocket, and other in the lower mono. Crimps and another pocket lead to an easy topout. (FA Trent Hoover, 2016.)

problems.name: Wilderpeople
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start with large left-hand sidepull, and right-hand on sloper immediately beside.  Move up and left. (FA Trent Hoover, 2016)

problems.name: The Trapdoor
problems.description: Located  a few meters right of the Wilderpeople boulder. V0. Sit start left hand high on good sloper/sidepull on left arete, right hand on small crimp in middle of face. Teeter up to rounded 6ft peak. (FA Kyle Marco, 2017)

problems.name: Saddle Up
problems.description: 7 or 8 m right of Wilderpeople. V0. Sit start under arete, next to tree, left hand high on good edge or side pull, right hand low on side pull. Move up on good holds.  (FA Dan Anhorn, 2017)

problems.name: Western Outlet
problems.description: V1. Sit start matched with left hand on obvious jug, right hand on side pull above that. Use jugs crimps and a sloper pinch to mantle up the bulge. (FA Dan Anhorn, 2017.)

problems.name: Wilderpeople
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start with large left-hand sidepull, and right-hand on sloper immediately beside.  Move up and left. (FA Trent Hoover, 2016)

problems.name: Wolf's Den
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start in cave on crimps.  Climb roof out to lip and mantle. (FA Mark Derksen, 2014)

problems.name: Skull slab
problems.description: Big low angle slab problems all over. At this angle it looks a little like a skull...

problems.name: Asking For Directions
problems.description: Start on the far left side of the west face with right hand on large undercling and left hand on any one of the sloping edges.  Fire straight up to the lip.  Dabby due to small boulder behind you.  FA-Mitch Goertzen

problems.name: Tacos
problems.description: Sit start on huge sloping shelf in middle of the west face. Move left through small edges then up to the lip to top out.  FA- Kent Dunham

problems.name: Bathroom Break
problems.description:
Sit start on huge sloping shelf and climb straight up the face for an easy top out.
FA- Mitch Goertzen

problems.name: Gas Station Tamales
problems.description: Sit start on left side of south face using a good right edge and left side-pull/undercling. Make a difficult first move to tuck under the roof, then reach for the thank-God knob.  Pull over the lip using the large edge for your right and the arrete for your left and top out left.  FA- Kent Dunham

problems.name: Nachos of Regret Left
problems.description:
Sit start on the right side of the south face on good edges.  Slap up the right side arrete to gain the monster jug over the lip of the roof.  Move left to big side pull and pull straight up over the lip to and easy top out.  
FA- Kent Dunham

problems.name: Gas Station Tamales
problems.description: Sit start on left side of south face using a good right edge and left side-pull/undercling. Make a difficult first move to tuck under the roof, then reach for the thank-God knob.  Pull over the lip using the large edge for your right and the arrete for your left and top out left.  FA- Kent Dunham

problems.name: Nachos of Regret Left
problems.description:
Sit start on the right side of the south face on good edges.  Slap up the right side arrete to gain the monster jug over the lip of the roof.  Move left to big side pull and pull straight up over the lip to and easy top out.  
FA- Kent Dunham

problems.name: Nachos of Regret Right
problems.description:
Same start as Nachos Left, but at the lip continue right to top out.
FA- Mitch Goertzen

problems.name: V0
problems.description: You will see this boulder facing you on your left shortly after stepping off the Albatross gravel road, and walking on the grassy track towards the Healing boulder.  Climb the left side of the slab.

problems.name: The Ice Cave
problems.description: Sit-start with right hand on long edge and left on either a strange, crimp-pocket or a low, sloping sidepull.  Climb through crimps, rails, and sloping pinches to finish on a flat rail.  Great movement.  A lower start (left hand on sidepull, right on a three-finger undercling) has been done at more-or-less the same grade.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: The Ice Cave right
problems.description: V7+.  Start as per "The Ice Cave" but, after the first move, head right, using the corner feature to gain a left-facing gaston edge in the face below the peak.  From this edge, either throw to the lip above, or do a bit of a trick to finish on "Sardine".  A bit contrived/eliminate, but cool holds and sequence, with tensiony and powerful moves.

problems.name: Sardine
problems.description: A fun problem with an ugly start.  Sit-start very low, scrunched down on the right side of the Foxhole cave, with right hand on a good jug, and left on a sidepull crimp.  Climb positive edges and ledges above, desperately trying not to dab on the block.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: The Trumpocalypse
problems.description: Sit in the hole between 2 boulders, left hand on the blocky undercling, right hand gaston on blocky section above.  Punch up and right to a sloping crimp.  Rearrange your feet and bump again to the sloper rail above.  Move to the lip with the help of a small crimp to the left.  Easy top out. (FA K. Dunham, 2016)

problems.name: The Incident
problems.description: Sit-start on the same hold as "Relentless Sit", but head up and left to two good, side-by-side crimps, then continue up the tall slab.  The stand-start from the side-by-side crimps goes at V1.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2013)

problems.name: Relentlesser
problems.description: Start, and climb, as per "Relentless Sit-Start".  Upon gaining the right-hand arete, continue right to finish up the dihedral.

problems.name: Relentless
problems.description:
V6. Start standing with left hand on a good sidepull edge, and right on a blunt sidepull.  Fun compression moves lead to a big, sloping shelf, and easier moves above.  Superb!
A sit-start (V7) begins on a positive, left-facing sidepull (low and to the left).  (FA Evan Erickson, 2007)

problems.name: Obvious Fricking Dihedral
problems.description: Climb the obvious dihedral.  A sit-start (V5) can be done starting on a good edge at the bottom right corner of the face to the right of the dihedral.

problems.name: The Purest Line
problems.description: Start as per "Obvious Frickin' Dihedral Sit".  Traverse left into the crux of "Relentless", and finish on that problem.

problems.name: The Purest Line ext.
problems.description: Climb "The Purest Line", but continue left, through the start holds of "Relentless", to gain the twin-crimps that "The Incident Stand-Start" begins on.  Finish up "The Incident".

problems.name: Redonculous
problems.description: V5. Start as for "Krimptonite", but climb up and left, using arete feature.

problems.name: Krimptonite
problems.description: V8. Sit-start on crimps below the short arete feature.  Pull into shallow dihedral, reach right to a crimp on the face, and continue up and right on edges.  Short and hard!  (FA Evan Erickson)

problems.name: Under a Yellow Sun
problems.description: Sit-start using slopers.

problems.name: Unnamed
problems.description: Crimpy face.

problems.name: Boo-Yeah
problems.description: The thin seam.

problems.name: Scarleg
problems.description: The left side of the tall arete.

problems.name: Origins
problems.description: Sit-start on diagonal rail sidepulls just right of arete.  Follow the crack left, then climb the arete.  "Origins Extension" (V1) continues following the crack leftwards to top out around the arete.

problems.name: Crack Attack
problems.description: Climb the obvious, sharp arete.  Watch for loose rock at all times in Frank; a large block fell off this problem in 2010.

problems.name: The Remedy
problems.description: Sit-start as per "The Sage".  Traverse right and finish on either "Jahealy" or "Easy Healing".

problems.name: Sage
problems.description: Sit-start with a high left handhold and a very low right.  Climb the crimpy face and left-leaning seam just right of "Crack Attack".  The other boulder (the other side of the "crack") is out, of course.

problems.name: Prisoner's Dilemma
problems.description: Start with sidepull/pinch for left hand, and flat crimp for right hand.  Climb the face above, through sloping holds.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: I Pissed on the Starting Holds
problems.description: Sit-start with right hand on a good crimp, and left on a small, sloping edge.  Climb up through small edges to a good sidepull, and top out above.  (FA Evan Erickson, 2007)

problems.name: Jahealy
problems.description: Start at the low right side of the flake undercling, climb up and left along the flake until it thins out, then head straight up.  Alternatively, go straight up from the very start at the same grade (Jahealy direct)

problems.name: Japissy
problems.description: V4ish.  Start as per "Jahealy", but move up and left into "IPotSH".  A good variation.

problems.name: Easy Healing
problems.description: Climb the tall, juggy face immediately left of - and using - the prominent arete.  Beware the tricky mantle!

problems.name: Healing Traverse
problems.description: V6.  Sit-start at far left end of lip.  Traverse right, along lip, eventually joining "Healing Arete", and finishing on that problem.  (FA Marcus Norman)

problems.name: Healing Arete
problems.description: V5.  Sit-start under left end of roof, matched on left-facing sidepull.  Traverse right, under roof, to gain a large, blocky jug, under the right side of the arete.  From here, climb up the right-side of the arete.

problems.name: Healing Arete extension
problems.description: V3/4.  Start, and climb, as per "Healing Arete".  From the blocky jug, continue right, along juggy rails.  (FA Trent Hoover)

problems.name: Healing Arete left
problems.description: V7/8.  Start as per "Healing Arete", but move up and right, gaining arete and climbing up the left side. Slightly eliminate - the large shelf up and left of the start is out.

problems.name: Healing Arete Direct
problems.description: Start as per "Healing Arete", but head straight up the face left of the arete.  The name is a misnomer, because you don't actually use the arete.  A hold may have broken on this problem.

problems.name: The Grim Reacher
problems.description: V0.  Step onto slab, and climb to an overlap.  Find the large undercling, and use this to reach a jug on the arete.  Top out above.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Infected
problems.description: V5.  Sit-start under the left end of the cave/overhang, using a right-hand crimp and a left-hand sloper.  Climb up and right through the middle of the blank face.

problems.name: The Sickening
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start using good right-hand crimp, and smaller left-hand crimp beside.  Traverse left along rail/line of small edges, until you can mantle onto a sloping shelf.  From here, head up and right to a protrusion/shelf on the arete.  Turn the arete, and top out the slab.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: Shaman
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start as per "The Sickening", but climb directly up the left side of the arete..  (FA Mark Derksen, 2013)

problems.name: V0
problems.description: V0.  Sit-start under far right end of overhang/cave, matched on flat rail under arete.  Make a few moves up the arete, before rolling right onto the slab.

problems.name: Unnamed
problems.description: Climb the left side of the slab, using the huge feature at head-height.  To make things more interesting (and perhaps a grade or two harder), head rightwards out of the giant scoop feature, and keep the arete out of play until you can grab it above a small notch, or - better still - eliminate the left arete altogether, and go for the crack and right arete.

problems.name: Frankenstein
problems.description: This excellent slab problem climbs the tall slab on the right side of the boulder, straight up to the peak.  To keep the grade honest, stay clear of the protruding, grey shield on your left, and the arete on your right.  Trending left into the shield feature drops a grade or two, but is still a good line.  (FA Evan Erickson, 2007)

problems.name: Fifth Element
problems.description: Start by stepping onto the slab in the middle of the face, then taking a white, crimpy pinch with your left hand.  Dyno to a good hold right of the groove, and top out above.  A bit of an eliminate, but still good fun.

problems.name: Element
problems.description: Start as per "Open Road", but use crimps to head left and top out on the left side of the arete.

problems.name: Super Fetus Traverse
problems.description: Start as per "Open Road".  Upon gaining the lip, traverse it left to finish on "Fifth Element".  (FA Evan Erickson, 2007)

problems.name: Open Road
problems.description: Start on good edge right of the arete.  Climb up the arete.

problems.name: Flat Earth Society
problems.description: On the back of the Element boulder is a tall, aesthetic slab with a small pod in the middle of it.  Climb the slab just left of (and using) the pod.  Fun, with a bit of choss on the top out.  For a more sustained outing (airier, but no harder), trend rightwards up the smooth face of the slab, avoiding anything large enough to mar the slab experience.

problems.name: Ounce of Skin
problems.description: V3/4.  Sit-start using low, opposing sidepulls under short bulge/prow.  Move up the tricky arete above.  (FA Kim Lee, 2017)

problems.name: Pound of Flesh
problems.description: V6/7.  Sit-start using low, blocky sidepull for the right-hand, and anything same-height or lower for your left.  Climb the cryptic arete.

problems.name: Short Tree
problems.description: Start as per "Trees Traverse", but after the first few moves, climb straight up the overhanging face on crimps.  A sit-start on incut crimps below the rail can be done at around V2.

problems.name: Trees Traverse
problems.description: Sit-start on the far left of the big, sloping rail, and traverse right. As the ledge peters out, you'll reach a series of crimps.  Climb these to the top.  Fun!

problems.name: Trees Direct
problems.description: Start as per "Trees Traverse", but climb directly up the slabby arete.

problems.name: Trees Traverse Extension
problems.description: Start as per "Trees Traverse", but continue right from the end of the sloping rail, and finish on "Broken Tree".  Holds have broken from this problem - it may no longer be possible or pleasant.

problems.name: Broken Tree
problems.description: Climb the right side of the face to the tallest point.  Holds break regularly from this problem, so it'll likely change with time.  A slightly harder sit-start has also been done.

problems.name: The Quick and the Dead
problems.description: Another great, high slab on the Trees boulder.  This one ascends a line of incut crimps on the left side of the face.  Fun!  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Ride the River
problems.description: The well-featured, steep slab in the middle of the face.  Great movement, solid holds.

problems.name: High Noon
problems.description: On the right side of the slabby face (facing the slide), there is a right-leaning arete.  This problem starts on a horn on the arete.  Climb up and across the arete using a sloping ledge, then use the arete and crimps to gain a huge jug high on the face. Top out above.  Spectacular problem with great exposure!

problems.name: Evasive Maneuvers
problems.description: Sit-start matched on huge undercling feature.  Use the arete on your right (above tree), and small, bad face holds to the left, to gain a flat top-out.  Watch the tree dab!

problems.name: Battle of the Hearts
problems.description: V5. Start matched on obvious long edge left of arete, and climb the overhanging arete.  (FA Evan Erickson)

problems.name: Pulmonary Anarchy
problems.description: V5. Start with left-hand on rail feature in overhang, and right-hand on a sloper lower down on the arete.  Climb the left side of the arete.  (FA Evan Erickson)

problems.name: Pulmonary Anarchy
problems.description: V5. Start with left-hand on rail feature in overhang, and right-hand on a sloper lower down on the arete.  Climb the left side of the arete.  (FA Evan Erickson)

problems.name: Queen of Hearts
problems.description: V1. Start on the left side of the slab left hand on tiny crimp and right hand in square two-finger pocket. Climb to the left peak.

problems.name: Middle Heart Slab
problems.description: V1. Start with left hand in square two-finger pocket, right hand on sharp edge.  Climb to the notch and top out.

problems.name: Heart Attack
problems.description: V1. Climb the right side of the slabby face to the right peak.

problems.name: Heart Slab Arete
problems.description: V0. Sit start. Climb the slab, using the arete on your right.

problems.name: K-Dog's Revenge
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start, and climb the right-side of the arete,  (FA Kyle Marco)

problems.name: The Conjuring
problems.description: V1.  Sit-start matched in the overhanging section of the finger-crack.  Move directly up the crack, and onto the slab above.

problems.name: The Vexing
problems.description: V7.  Sit-start, matched, underclinging the finger-crack in the overhang.  Move up and left, compressing left-facing crimps and edges, and the right-hand crack, eventually gaining incut rails on the slab to top out.

problems.name: Abstract Reality
problems.description: V3.  Stand-start, and climb the right side of the arete, until you can gain the obvious, high fin feature with your right hand.  Use this to rock onto, and finish up, the slab.

problems.name: The Grand Illusion
problems.description: V5.  Start, and climb, as per "Abstract Reality", but continue along the right side of the arete, topping out at the peak of the boulder.

problems.name: Abstract Reality left
problems.description: V1/2.  Start as per "Abstract Reality", but head up and left, away from arete and immediately onto slab.

problems.name: The Miracle
problems.description: V4.  Start matched on obvious left-facing flake-jug.  Move up and left to gain arete, then climb the right side of the arete, topping out at the peak of the boulder.

problems.name: The Mirage
problems.description: V4.  Start as per "The Miracle", but head up and right, to the arete/lip, before heading back left, to rejoin "The Miracle" at its top-out.

problems.name: No Oasis
problems.description: V4.  Start right of the arete on a slopey pod and a low, good edge.  Hit a sharp, right-facing sidepull, then continue up through a good rail, topping out onto the slab.

problems.name: Counterbalance
problems.description: V0. Start standing on a good hold at the bottom of the centre of the slab, with a left gaston and something terrible for the right. Traverse left to a jug, then surf the lip right to top out at the peak.

problems.name: Cantilever
problems.description: V1. Start as for "Counterbalance", and climb straight up the slab.

problems.name: Jenga
problems.description: V0+. Start as for "Counterbalance", and climb up and right to right arete, following it to peak. Mind the ramp landing.

problems.name: K-Dog's Revenge
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start, and climb the right-side of the arete,  (FA Kyle Marco)

problems.name: Disappearing Act
problems.description: V6.  Eliminate (the arete on your right is out).  Sit-start as per "Presto", and climb up and left, using face holds only.

problems.name: Presto!
problems.description: V3.  Sit-start with right-hand pinch and lower left-hand edge.  Climb up and left, using the arete on your right and face holds on your left.

problems.name: The Miracle
problems.description: V4.  Start matched on obvious left-facing flake-jug.  Move up and left to gain arete, then climb the right side of the arete, topping out at the peak of the boulder.

problems.name: No Oasis
problems.description: V4.  Start right of the arete on a slopey pod and a low, good edge.  Hit a sharp, right-facing sidepull, then continue up through a good rail, topping out onto the slab.

problems.name: Play it by Ear
problems.description: V9. Sit-start matched on massive sloper-rail in cave. Move up and right to join "Clan of the Cave Bear". (FA Mark Derksen)

problems.name: Clan of the Cave Bear
problems.description: V2. Sit-start using lowest holds on lip. Traverse the lip up and left using good edges. (FA Trent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: Yogi Bear
problems.description: V7ish. Sit-start in cave, matched on low, obvious crimp-rail. Move up and right, gaining the lip/arete, and finishing on "Clan of the Cave Bear".

problems.name: Evil Sigh
problems.description: V7. Sit-start with good right-hand crimp in cave, and left-hand lower on arete.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2019)

problems.name: Dragon Fire
problems.description: Sit-start using low blocky hold(s).  Head directly up, eventually gaining a large, flat jug up high.  Head right to top out.

problems.name: Dark Age
problems.description: V10/11.  Start as per "Rhythmic Gymnastics", and traverse left, through "Dragonfire", continuing to the lip up and left.  Continue left to top out.  (FA Adam Currie).

problems.name: Rhythmic Gymnastics
problems.description: Start using a set of crimps low in the cave (or, alternatively, under "Dragonfire", using blocky, opposing holds).  Move up to good edges in the grey rock above, and slightly left to top out.

problems.name: Rhythmic Gymnastics low
problems.description: Start as per "Fission", but head up and left into " Rhythmic Gymnastics".

problems.name: Dark Age low
problems.description: Start as per "Rhythmic Gymnastics low", and link into "Dark Age".

problems.name: Fission
problems.description: Sit-start low in pit, with small triangle notch for left-hand, and small crimp knob for right-hand.  Climb and top out straight up.

problems.name: The Weirding Way
problems.description: V3.  Stand-start using good chest-height edges.  Climb, and top out, directly above.

problems.name: Mushroom Campus low
problems.description: Start as per "Fission", and climb into the start hold of " Mushroom Campus", finishing on that line.

problems.name: Quantum Leap
problems.description: V12.  Start as per "Mushroom Campus", and link into "Dark Age".   For the original line, anything on the lip is considered out (including the high right-hand sloper of "Dragon Fire") until moving up and left from the block-jug.

problems.name: Mushroom Dyno
problems.description: V5.  Start on same hold as "Mushroom Campus", but dyno to the flat lip, up and left.  Top out direct.

problems.name: Nucleus short
problems.description: Start as per "Mushroom Campus", but head left, into the overhang, then up from there.

problems.name: Mushroom Campus
problems.description: Start on head-height jug on arete.  Thug up and slightly right on juggy edges.

problems.name: Nucleus
problems.description: Start on "Mushroom Campus", and traverse left through the cave, finishing up "Rhythmic Gymnastics".  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Psilocybin
problems.description: Start matched on blocky, chest-height jug in the corridor between boulders.  Move right, through small crimps in crack, eventually reaching a juggy edge and easy topout.

problems.name: Race to the Top ext.
problems.description: Start, and climb, as per "Race to the Top".  At the horizontal break, continue right, along shelf, before topping out.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Race to the Top
problems.description: Sit-start at base of diagonal rail that heads up and left.  Follow this rail to the horizontal break.  Follow the horizontal break slightly right, then top out through the face.  Alternatively, finish by following the horizontal break left, to join the topout of "Psilocybin". (FA Evan Erickson, 2013)

problems.name: Mushroom Campus
problems.description: Start on head-height jug on arete.  Thug up and slightly right on juggy edges.

problems.name: Nogaku
problems.description: V4/5.  Stand-start with high right-hand knob/pinch on arete, and left-hand anywhere at the same height or lower.  Climb the overhanging arete.  Tall, with poor rock quality.

problems.name: Bunraku
problems.description: V5.  Stack pads to reach the obvious incut right-hand edge.  Grab anything at the same height or lower with your left-hand, paste your feet on, and throw to the good holds out left, joining the top out of "Nogaku".

problems.name: Kabuki sit
problems.description: V8.  Sit-start using low right-hand sidepull/undercling, and higher left-hand gaston.  Move up and right to join "Kabuki".

problems.name: Kabuki direct sit
