problems.description: V8/9.  Start as per "Kabuki sit", and climb up into the direct finish.

problems.name: Kabuki direct
problems.description: V6/7.  Start as per "Kabuki", but head directly up the face.

problems.name: Kabuki
problems.description: V5.  Stand-start with obvious high left-hand pinch and lower right-hand jug.  Move up and right to lip/arete, then back left, along lip, to top out at peak of boulder.

problems.name: A Day at the Beach
problems.description: V5/6.  Crouch-start, using low opposing edges at far left of face..  Traverse the face at mid-height, joining the topout of "Pamela Anderson".

problems.name: Castles in the Sand
problems.description: V7ish. Start as per "A Day at the Beach", but climb up the face directly above.

problems.name: A Long Day at the Beach
problems.description: V6/7. Start, and climb, as per "A Day at the Beach", but continue right, gaining the stand-start crimps of "Pamela Anderson", and joining into "Beachcomber", finishing on that problem.

problems.name: Half-Life Low
problems.description: V6ish. Once a great, hard line, breakage has made it much easier and allowed it to be more-or-less supplanted by "Storm the Beach". Sit-start matched on obvious sloper-block low in cave.  Move up and right to join "Half-Life".

problems.name: Half-Life
problems.description: V4. Stand-start using good left-hand sidepull, and large right-hand edge.  Move up and slightly right. (FA Trent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: Obelisk
problems.description: V4. Start as for Half Life, but climb up and slightly left to a dynamic move for the juggy notch. (FA, ?)

problems.name: Storm the Beach
problems.description: V7/8. Start with right-hand on the large "loaf" edge (the start of "Undertow"), and left-hand anywhere lower under the roof. Move left into "Half Life low" and finish up that problem.

problems.name: Undertow
problems.description: V10. Start on obvious wide, angled edge very low in cave.  Use a huge, flat sidepull up and right, and some grim intermediates out left, to climb direct, out of the cave, and up the face above.

problems.name: Pamela Anderson
problems.description: V4. Stand-start using face-height crimps.  Move up and left, through crimps, to jugs.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: Pamela Anderson sit
problems.description: V6ish.  Sit-start using whatever holds seem feasible/logical.  Move up to obvious mini-horn, and continue up and left to join "Pamela Anderson".  Has also been started lower (laying down), using two small slots just above the lip of the cave, at more-or-less the same grade.

problems.name: The Hoff
problems.description: V2. Start as per ``Pamela Anderson``, but climb straight up.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Life's a Beach
problems.description: V2ish. Sit-start at base of arete, with right-hand high on a good pinch, and left-hand anywhere lower.. Climb the left side of the tricky arete.

problems.name: Slippery Pete
problems.description: V 7/8. Sit-start using good right-hand edge, and large left-hand rail.  Move up and left, to the arete.  Continue up the right side of the arete, to topout.  (FA Kyle Marco, 2015)

problems.name: Slippery Pete right
problems.description: V9/10.  Sit-start using good left-hand edge, and nearby right-hand crimp.  Move up and right, compressing right arete and left edges/crimps.

problems.name: The Resurgence
problems.description: V8. Start as per "Storm the Beach" (right hand on large "loaf" edge, and left hand anywhere under roof). Climb the bottom (crux) section of that climb, then join "Castles in the Sand" at mid-height, adding a tricky transition plus the crux of that problem.

problems.name: Long Walks on the Beach
problems.description: V9+. Do the lay-down start to "Pamela Anderson", starting in the small slots. Climb to the stand-start holds, then traverse the entire face left, finishing on "Castles in the Sand".

problems.name: Shelter
problems.description: V10/11. Sit-start as per "Undertow" (matched on loaf edge). Move up and right to the large sidepull feature, matching this to continue up and right to the obvious crimp-horn, FInish straight up from there. (FA Mark Eveleigh)

problems.name: Storm Tide
problems.description: V8/9. Start, and climb, as per "Storm the Beach". After gaining a large, juggy edge, cut right into crimps, joining and finishing on "A Long Day at the Beach".

problems.name: The Wheel of Beach Cave
problems.description: V11ish. Start, and climb, as per "Shelter", but join and finish on "Long Walks on the Beach".

problems.name: Smooth
problems.description: Climb the left side of the slab.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: The Frayed Edge
problems.description: Climb the right edge of the slab. (FA Trent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: Prodigal Son
problems.description: V6. Sit-start using notched left-hand sloper, and low right-hand sidepull (both holds outside the cave, just above the lip).  Follow the lip to gain arete, and top out.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: Flowstone
problems.description: V6ish.  Sit-start under blunt arete, using good right-hand edge, and slopey left-hand pinch.  Move up the arete, and slightly right to top out.

problems.name: Prodigal Son low
problems.description: V8ish. Sit/lay-down start in cave, using low, opposing sidepulls in the overhang (left hand is juggy, right hand is bad). Move out right to the arete, then up out of the cave.

problems.name: Prodigal Son
problems.description: V6. Sit-start using notched left-hand sloper, and low right-hand sidepull (both holds outside the cave, just above the lip).  Follow the lip to gain arete, and top out.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: Think Tank
problems.description: Start as per ``The Mentalist``, but continue left to exit on jugs.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: The Mentalist
problems.description: Sit-start using large ramp.  Climb the left side of the arete.

problems.name: Prodigal Son low
problems.description: V8ish. Sit/lay-down start in cave, using low, opposing sidepulls in the overhang (left hand is juggy, right hand is bad). Move out right to the arete, then up out of the cave.

problems.name: Devil in the Detail
problems.description: V4/5. Sit-start in small cave, left-hand near the top of large sidepull feature, and right-hand on a low, hidden undercling.  Head up and right, through edges to a large jug. Finish either left (by pressing up onto the slab), or right (following more jugs and mantling around the corner). Will feel exponentially harder until the correct foot beta is found.

problems.name: MicroDyno
problems.description: V5ish. Sit-start, right-hand gastoning bottom-end of large rail, and left-hand anywhere lower. Move left up to a small crimp with a pocket thumb-catch, then pop to the jug above. Exit left or right.

problems.name: Tick Tock
problems.description: V4. Sit-start matched on large edge low in middle of face. Move up and right to a good rail. Follow this rail to the arete to top out. (FA Trent Hoover, 2019)

problems.name: The Path left
problems.description: V2. Sit-start matched on low, large edge. Move up to a rail directly above, then head left along rail and lip, to tricky topout. (FA Trent Hoover, 2019)

problems.name: The Direct Path
problems.description: V2. Sit-start matched on low, large edge. Climb, and top out, straight up. (FA Trent Hoover, 2019)

problems.name: The Path right
problems.description: V2. Sit-start matched on low, large edge. Climb directly up, through rail, to lip, then traverse right to top out. (FA Trent Hoover, 2019)

problems.name: The Path of Most Resistance
problems.description: V3ish. Eliminate. Start at far right, one-hand on arete and one-hand on rail. Traverse the rail (without using lip of boulder) left, until you can join, and finish on, "The Path left".

problems.name: LaFleur
problems.description: Sit-start in pit, using good, flat right-hand edge, and a right-facing edge on the arete for your left-hand.  Follow the lip up and left, to gain the mini-corner, and top-out.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Wolverine
problems.description: Sit-start under corner feature.  Climb the slab/bulge above.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Microcosm
problems.description: V1. Sit-start as per "Microscopy", but head up and left. (FA Trent Hoover, 2019)

problems.name: Microscopy
problems.description: About 15m east of "LaFleur".  Sit-start matched at a multi-faceted diagonal edge feature.  Traverse up and right, using miniscule holds to gain a juggy feature high to the right.  Continue up slab.  Stemming at the start might help.

problems.name: Microbe
problems.description: V1/2. Sit-start using left-hand pinch/sidepull in dihedral, and opposing right-hand sidepull. Move up and left. (FA Trent Hoover, 2019)

problems.name: Microagression
problems.description: V0. Sit-start with opposing sidepulls, and climb the slab above. (FA Trent Hoover, 2019)

problems.name: Yoshi's Island
problems.description: Sit-start using lowest rails.  Head up, using more rails, and the arete to your left.  Gain lip, and roll onto slab to top out.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: True Detective
problems.description: V7.  Stand-start with left-hand sidepull jug, and right-hand on good rail below.  Follow the lip of the boulder up and right, all the way to the right arete, using that to top out.

problems.name: True Detective direct
problems.description: Start, and climb, as per "True Detective".  After the midpoint crux, head up the slab via the left-facing rails.

problems.name: Yoshi's Island
problems.description: Sit-start using lowest rails.  Head up, using more rails, and the arete to your left.  Gain lip, and roll onto slab to top out.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: True Detective
problems.description: V7.  Stand-start with left-hand sidepull jug, and right-hand on good rail below.  Follow the lip of the boulder up and right, all the way to the right arete, using that to top out.

problems.name: True Detective direct
problems.description: Start, and climb, as per "True Detective".  After the midpoint crux, head up the slab via the left-facing rails.

problems.name: Mighty Mite
problems.description: V8.  Sit-start with left-hand on arete, and right-hand on horizontal crimp.  Climb the right side of the arete.

problems.name: Feeling Flat
problems.description: V0.  Start matched on lowest flat shelf.  Climb up and left, along more shelf-like jugs.

problems.name: The Optimist
problems.description: V5.  Sit-start, with left-hand at the top of a sidepull rail in the cave, and right-hand on a low incut outside the cave.  Climb up and left.

problems.name: Beach Cave
problems.description: *see Beach Cave topos to view problems.

problems.name: Thumb War
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start, matched on good edge way down and right.  Head up and left, using tricky edges, and a sloping foot rail.

problems.name: Low Gear
problems.description: V3.  Sit-start, with right-hand on small, round sloper above the lip, and left-hand sloper on the lip.  Climb up the short, blunt arete.

problems.name: Slippery Pete
problems.description: *see Beach Cave topos for full description.

problems.name: Simple Pleasures
problems.description: V5.  Sit-start, using left facing edges low in the middle of the face.  Climb direct to lip, through a good right-hand sidepull/incut.

problems.name: Thumb War
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start, matched on good edge way down and right.  Head up and left, using tricky edges, and a sloping foot rail.

problems.name: Beautiful Struggle boulder
problems.description: *see Beautiful Struggle topo for details.

problems.name: The Quintessential
problems.description: V8.  Sit-start with right-hand on lowest obvious sidepull crimp outside cave, and right-hand on a small, slick opposing crimp in the cave.  Head up to lip, and move right to top out.

problems.name: Gambler's Fallacy
problems.description: V2.  Just north of the Beautiful Struggle boulder.  Sit-start in a small pit between two rocks, using crimps at head-height.  Move up using edges, and the arete on your right.  (FA Dan Anhorn, 2016)

problems.name: Mad Hatter
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start under far left end of slopey lip.  Move up and right, along the lip, topping out at the peak.  (FA Kyle Marco, 2016)

problems.name: Mark's Madness
problems.description: V3.  Sit-start, matched on huge, obvious shelf. Climb the left side of the arete above. (FA Kyle Marco, 2016)

problems.name: The Shoe Pin
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start deep in the overhang.  Climb up right side of arete, using blocky features.  Watch for loose rock and a poor landing.  (FA Evan Erickson)

problems.name: Mighty Mite
problems.description: V8.  Sit-start with left-hand on arete, and right-hand on horizontal crimp.  Climb the right side of the arete.

problems.name: The Optimist
problems.description: V5.  Sit-start, with left-hand at the top of a sidepull rail in the cave, and right-hand on a low incut outside the cave.  Climb up and left.

problems.name: Mad Hatter
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start under far left end of slopey lip.  Move up and right, along the lip, topping out at the peak.  (FA Kyle Marco, 2016)

problems.name: Mark's Madness
problems.description: V3.  Sit-start, matched on huge, obvious shelf. Climb the left side of the arete above. (FA Kyle Marco, 2016)

problems.name: The Better Start
problems.description: V4. Sit-start using a low, slopey edge for your left-hand, and a good curved edge higher up for your right. Climb diagonally up and right, along edges, topping out at the peak.

problems.name: The Quintessential
problems.description: V8.  Sit-start with right-hand on lowest obvious sidepull crimp outside cave, and right-hand on a small, slick opposing crimp in the cave.  Head up to lip, and move right to top out.

problems.name: Mad Hatter
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start under far left end of slopey lip.  Move up and right, along the lip, topping out at the peak.  (FA Kyle Marco, 2016)

problems.name: Mark's Madness
problems.description: V3.  Sit-start, matched on huge, obvious shelf. Climb the left side of the arete above. (FA Kyle Marco, 2016)

problems.name: Closing Remarks
problems.description: V6.  Start matched at the far left end of the lip.  Traverse the lip all the way right, topping out up the arete. (FA Mark Derksen, 2016)

problems.name: BASW
problems.description: V2. Sit start under right side of overhang, matched on face-height crimps. Follow side-pulls and crimps up slab to peak. (FA Dan Anhorn, 2019)

problems.name: BASW Traverse
problems.description:
V2. Sit start under right side of overhang, matched on crimps at face height. Move up slightly then head left into a seam with a massive jug rail. Continue left and hop up onto slab as feet run out, and walk off at dihedral.  (FA Dan Anhorn, 2019.)
***A much harder eliminate version on small crimps & bad holds that traverses lower across the overhang (without using the massive jug rail) and topping out at dihedral feature awaits an ascent.

problems.name: Karst-y Crack Traverse
problems.description: V2/3. Start matched in lowest pod in crack(around face height). Traverse right to under the overhanging peak and make a bold-er move up to lip and mantle.  LOCATED in a deep south facing pit NE of Mushroom boulder.

problems.name: V0
problems.description: V0.  Left side of the slab.

problems.name: V0
problems.description: V0.  Taller, right side of the slab.

problems.name: Found
problems.description: V3.  Sit-start matched on the left hand start hold of "Lost", then head up and left to exit on the tall slab.  Tricky!  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Stolen
problems.description: V8.  Start (and climb) as per "Shelley was a Doctor First", but rather than traversing all the way to the dihedral, climb up the right side of the blunt arete once you are able to do so, and continue up and right to the peak of the slab.  See video beta to clarify.

problems.name: Lost
problems.description: V6/7.  Sit-start low on the left side of the little cave, with your left hand on a small, incut sidepull just outside the cave, and your right hand on either the sidepull just inside the cave, or a small crimp beside your left hand.  Powerful moves lead up and right to the blunt arete.  Finish up the slab above.  A great problem defined by several perfect "Frank Edges".

problems.name: Shelley was a Doctor First Extension
problems.description: V11.  Start, and climb, as per "SwaDF".  Once you gain the mini-jug on the far right of the dihedral, match, and continue right through a series of technical moves on sloping holds, until you link up with the mid-point of "Plan 66" and "Problem Four".  Finish up either of those highballs.  The extension itself is probably only V4, but the nature of the holds and moves make it very difficult to finish.

problems.name: Shelley was a Doctor First
problems.description: V10.  Start as per "Lost", but instead of heading up along the lip of the small cave, reach into the cave for a small edge, and use this to continue traversing the lip rightwards to a small jug on the far right wall.  From here, head back left on the slab to top out.  Very cool line (although a bit of an eliminate)!  (FA Terry Paholek, 2013)

problems.name: Over the Top
problems.description: V1/2.  Stand-start off rock, using small right-hand jug to press into dihedral.  Climb directly over bulge above.

problems.name: Problem Four
problems.description: V2.  Highball!  Start as per "Plan 66", but continue straight up the tall, white-striped face instead of traversing up and right.  Spooky.

problems.name: Plan 66
problems.description: V3.  Start on the positive undercling/sidepull at the base of the blunt arete.  Follow right-trending rails and sidepulls up and right until it is possible to reach the lip of the boulder.  A fun problem, but dangerous where the line climbs above two large blocks at the base.

problems.name: Super Galactic
problems.description: V7.  Sit-start under roof, with your left hand on a good pinch and your right hand on a sidepull.  Climb directly out overhang, using arete to your right.  (FA Kent Dunham, 2016)

problems.name: Super Galactic
problems.description: V7.  Sit-start under roof, with your left hand on a good pinch and your right hand on a sidepull.  Climb directly out overhang, using arete to your right.  (FA Kent Dunham, 2016)

problems.name: Galactic Direct
problems.description: V5/6.  Start as per "Galactic", but head up and right on thin holds.

problems.name: Galactic
problems.description: V3.  Start low on obvious, blocky ledge hold.  Traverse positive holds up and left towards the arete, and mantle above.

problems.name: Asscavation
problems.description: V6. Start deep in the cave. Move out over rail without dabbing.

problems.name: Cartel
problems.description: V8.  Sit-start on the large edge low on the right side of the face.  Traverse left on edges, then throw for the lip, and top out above.  Powerful! (FA Seth Mason)

problems.name: Goon Low
problems.description: V6.  Start as per "Cartel", but after the first move, reach directly up to the lip, and finish as per "Goon".  (FA Marcus Norman, 2006)

problems.name: Vlad
problems.description: V9.  Very eliminate, very forced.  Start on the "Cartel" start holds and go straight up to topout.  The good crimp you grab on the first move to the left on "Cartel" and "Goon Low" is out.  Basically, ignore everything except a little, dimple undercling right above you, and the lip of the boulder.   You might have better luck just dynoing. (FA Seth Mason, 2003)

problems.name: Goon
problems.description: V3.  Start on the lip at the right side of the cave (or further right, in gap between boulders, if you wish).  Traverse left to the middle of the face, and top out there.  Traverse can be extended to the nose of the arete at far left (at the same grade).

problems.name: Crowded House
problems.description: V9.  Sit-start in cave, matched on good undercling.  Use blocky rail to gain a mini-horn/block with your right-hand, and an edge in the roof with your left.  Move up and left to a slopey lip encounter, and jugs above.  Traverse slightly right to mantle and top-out.

problems.name: House of Cards
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start just right of the massive roof, using a large right-hand sloper/shelf, and left incut crimp.  Head up and left to an easy, but tall, top out.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Something Upstairs
problems.description: V4.  Highball.  Stand-start left of tree, using high (7.5'), right-facing crimp, and anything lower to help pull on.  Make a dynamic move to an edge.  Another dynamic move gains a horn on the lip.  Traverse way right to top-out on "Spring Cleaning".  Substantial cleaning may reveal a more direct topout.

problems.name: Spring Cleaning sit
problems.description: V8/9.  Start with tiny triangle crimp for left-hand, and, well . . . nothing for your right.  Pull on one-handed, and reach right-hand to a pinch-edge.  Continue up and right, to join the stand-start.

problems.name: Spring Cleaning
problems.description: V4.  Stand-start right of tree, matched on large, incut edge.  Move up and right to a wide, dusty pinch.  A high left-foot helps gain intermediates and lip.  Dirty top-out.

problems.name: Colossus
problems.description: V7/8.  Stand-start and climb the overhanging arete until you can gain the obvious ledge at half-height.  Turn the arete and traverse left along the ledge to gain a relatively easy, but very serious, slab top-out, with a final crux at the very top of the boulder.

problems.name: Basement Suite
problems.description: V6.  Sit-start matched on edge.  Move up, then traverse right, to large jug-edge feature at/just above head-height.  Match, and drop-off.

problems.name: Crowded House
problems.description: V9.  Sit-start in cave, matched on good undercling.  Use blocky rail to gain a mini-horn/block with your right-hand, and an edge in the roof with your left.  Move up and left to a slopey lip encounter, and jugs above.  Traverse slightly right to mantle and top-out.

problems.name: Starfire
problems.description: V0.  At the uphill end of the Teen Titans boulder, sit-start with a blocky jug and climb the blunt arete.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Robin
problems.description: V1.  Just right of the "Starfire" arete, sit-start low on a positive mini-jug.  Climb crisp edges to an easy top out.

problems.name: Raven
problems.description: V2/3.  Just left of the prominent, downhill arete is a long, sidepull edge; sit-start with both hands on this edge, and head up using a lot of trickery.  Harder than it looks!  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Robin
problems.description: V1.  Just right of the "Starfire" arete, sit-start low on a positive mini-jug.  Climb crisp edges to an easy top out.

problems.name: Raven
problems.description: V2/3.  Just left of the prominent, downhill arete is a long, sidepull edge; sit-start with both hands on this edge, and head up using a lot of trickery.  Harder than it looks!  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Cyborg
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start with a left-hand crimp on the arete, and your right hand on the lowest good sloper.  Use blocky jugs and positive edges to head up to an easy mantle.

problems.name: Beast Boy
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start matched on positive edge at the far right of the highway-facing side of the boulder.  Traverse left along juggy ledge, and finish on "Cyborg".  Fun!  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Kyle's Dyno
problems.description: V6.  Sit-start using any two of the three shallow slots, and throw for the rounded jug at the lip.  (FA Kyle Marco)

problems.name: Dead or Alive
problems.description: V3.  Sit-start in the alcove under the little roof, using a good right-hand sidepull, and an edge or undercling with your left.  Dyno/deadpoint to the jug at the lip.

problems.name: La-Z-Boy
problems.description: V0.  Sit-start matched on a large, flat hold, and head up using a variety of friendly, flat edges.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Pocket Face
problems.description: V0.  Sit-start using flat edges in the middle of the face.  Do one move to the prominent pocket, then head up to the lip.

problems.name: Posturepedic
problems.description: V1.  Sit-start.  Sit-start using a crimpy right-hand hold just right of the arete, and a nebulous sloper or pinch for the left-hand.  Climb the blunt arete.

problems.name: Sofa Surfer
problems.description: V5.  Start as per "Posturepedic".  Traverse rightwards, across the giant, sloping shelf to finish as per "Sofa King".

problems.name: Sofa King
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start matched on the large, flattish hold on the right side of the scooped face.  Climb up and right along the blunt, angled arete.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Chesterfield
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start as per "Sofa King".  Mantle directly onto the sofa feature.  Top out above.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: Sofa Queen
problems.description: V3.  Sit-start as per "Sofa King", but head left, across the sloping shelf, then up the arete.

problems.name: Hug O' War
problems.description: V1.  Sit-start using two flat edges just above the lip of the small alcove at the base of the arete.  After the first-move crux, climb positive edges up to an easy lip encounter.

problems.name: Hide and Seek
problems.description: V2,  Use small edges and sidepulls to climb the vertical face about a meter right of "Hug O' War".

problems.name: Tipping Point
problems.description: V2.  Step onto the sloping shelf on the right side of the face, and use crimps, sidepulls, and finesse to reach positive holds at the lip.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: The Curse
problems.description: V5.  Sit-start with both hands on the large sloper, and climb the arete and face above.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: The Apostle
problems.description: V7.  Start as per "The Evangelist", and continue left, through edges.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: The Evangelist
problems.description: V7.  Sit-start using two low, right-facing sidepulls.  Move up and left, to another right-facing sidepull above, then trend up and right to a tricky top out.  (FA Evan Erickson, 2013)

problems.name: Lazarus
problems.description: V8.  Sit-start in narrow corridor, using obvious, good right-hand edge, and small three-finger edge nearby for your left.  Use face holds, and arete to your left, to gain a tricky top-out.  Beware the rock behind you!

problems.name: Lazarus low
problems.description: V9ish. Sit/lay-down start matched on obvious jug in the cave. A couple of tricky moves get you into the original start.

problems.name: Hit the Road
problems.description: V2.  Start by underclinging a large "V" feature on the left side of the boulder.

problems.name: Road Rage
problems.description: V3.  Sit-start with your right-hand on the arete, and your left either on a blunt sidepull or an incut sidepull (lower, and harder).

problems.name: April
problems.description: V0.  Stand-start left of small spruce tree.  Climb the slab, traversing the lip slightly to top out.

problems.name: Donatello
problems.description: V2.  Climb up right of the small tree, and a bit right of the crack.  This problem is arguably the best of the Ninja Turtle problems.

problems.name: Leonardo
problems.description: Essentially the middle of the Ninja Turtle slab, this problem climbs up the relatively blank slab about a meter or so left of the broken, juggy rib/groove.

problems.name: Splinter
problems.description: The broken, juggy rib/groove.  The easiest of the Ninja Turtle slab problems.

problems.name: Raphael
problems.description: The fun-but-tricky slab to the right of "Splinter".

problems.name: Michaelangelo
problems.description: The somewhat nebulously defined slab to the right of "Raphael".

problems.name: Casey Jones
problems.description: The rightmost of all the "Ninja Turtle" slab problems, just left of the blunt arete.  Short but tricky, avoid bailing out to the right.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: BeBop
problems.description: Starts a meter or so left of "Rock Steady" on a positive sidepull.

problems.name: Rocky Steady
problems.description: This fun, vertical problem starts just left of the tree on the backside of the Ninja Turtle boulder.  Solid rock, and a great flat landing.

problems.name: Chinese Tourist Attraction
problems.description: V5-7 range. Reach dependent rare steep climb that actually has holds. A near lay down start with left and right hands on good edges. Heel somewhere and squeeze up the blunt prow to an airy  lip encounter. (FA Mark Derksen, 2016)

problems.name: Whale Bones sit-start
problems.description: V7. Sit-start down and left, using low, conjoined left crimp and right incut edge.  Move up to crimps, then press out right to join "Whale Bones" stand holds.

problems.name: Whale Bones
problems.description: V6. Reach/hop up to tiny, left-facing crimps.  Crimp your way through bone-white protrusions, to an easy topout.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Glass Ballerina
problems.description: V3. Sit-start using face holds in the pit.  Balancey moves using the arete on your right and face hold on your left lead to an easy topout.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2013)

problems.name: Lazy Ballerina
problems.description: V0.  Stand-start on "Glass Ballerina" and, after a couple of moves, roll right , up onto the slab,  (FA Trent Hoover, 2018).

problems.name: Stairway to Evan
problems.description: V7. Sit-start using obvious, large sloper, and/or lower holds.  Move up and left through good edges.  (FA Evan Erickson, 2007)

problems.name: Stairway to Evan right
problems.description: V7. Start as per "Stairway to Evan", but head right after the first move.

problems.name: Dazed and Confused
problems.description: V5/6. Sit-start, using good right-hand sidepull, and slopey edge/pinch for your left.  Climb directly up.

problems.name: Den of Thieves
problems.description: V6. In the cave on the backside of "Stairway to Evan", sit-start using obvious jug on low rail feature, and higher left-hand sidepull edge.  Head directly out cave.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2016)

problems.name: Breathing Underwater
problems.description: V6/7. Sit-start under base of arete, using low left-hand sloper-pinch, and thin, somewhat awkward crimp-pinch for your right.  Power up the prow.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Expose
problems.description: V3. Left hand arete, right hand large ledge . Go up. (FA Mark Derksen, 2013)

problems.name: Lumberjack Special
problems.description: V5. Start left hand crimp, right hand sidepull. A deadpoint awaits. (FA Mark Derksen, 2013)

problems.name: Layman's Layback
problems.description: VB/0. Climb the giant crack to top. (FA Mark Derksen,  2013)

problems.name: Deep Blue Sea
problems.description: V2. Sit start matched on long flat edge, head up to lip, slight left to top out.(FA Trent Hoover, 2013)
V0. Sit start under arete overhang, matched on obvious sloper jug. Use a variety of excellent holds to climb the superb arete.

problems.name: Secrets of the Slide
problems.description: V1.  Sit-start at base of arete.  Climb right side of arete, topping out at peak of boulder.

problems.name: Secrets of the Slide Left
problems.description: V1.  Start, and climb, as per "Secrets of the Slide", but roll left at mid-height to top out.

problems.name: The Locked Room
problems.description: V6.  Sit-start using notched left-hand crimp and small right-hand sloper.  Climb up and left, joing the top of "Secrets of the Slide".

problems.name: Twist of Fate
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start with right-hand on good edge, and left-hand on sloper edge below.  Move up to obvious large edge feature, then up again to flat top-out.

problems.name: Dirty Tricks
problems.description: V0.  Start matched on huge rail.  Go up.

problems.name: Marooned
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start matched on the obvious low rail, left of the arete.  Climb the left side of the arete, rolling onto the slab to top out.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: At Sea
problems.description: V1.  Sit-start with hands on both sides of arete.  Climb up and right onto slab.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: Sail Left
problems.description: V1.  Stand-start using high, crozzly left-hand crimp/thumb-catch, and right-hand low on arete.  Climb the slab, using the arete on your right.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: Sail Left
problems.description: V1.  Stand-start using high, crozzly left-hand crimp/thumb-catch, and right-hand low on arete.  Climb the slab, using the arete on your right.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: Sail Right
problems.description: V1.  Stand-start.  Climb the right side of the arete.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: The Barndooriest Barndoor in the West
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start with left-hand on arete, and right-hand on . . . something.  Climb the right side of the arete,

problems.name: Warm up the Pressies
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start using obvious, low left-facing edges.  Move up and right.

problems.name: Warm up the Pullies
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start as per "Warm Up the Pressies", but move up and right.

problems.name: Warm up the Fingies
problems.description: V0.  Sit-start in pit, using good edges low on arete.  Climb the left side of the arete.

problems.name: In Terra Pax
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start with right-hand on high, positive edge below lip, and left-hand on sloper in overhang.  Move up and right to join "Tricks of the Trade".  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: Tricks of the Trade
problems.description: V6.  Sit-start using left-hand gaston edge in overhang, and square-cut right-hand sidepull/undercling under overlap.  Move up and left to a pair of small crimps on arete, left again to gain high, positive sidepull, then roll onto the slab to top out.

problems.name: Good Will
problems.description: V0/1.  Sit-start using large, incut sidepull edge for left-hand, and flat right-hand edge/rail.  Rock onto slab, and continue up.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: A Means to an End
problems.description: V3.  Start as per "Unknown Pleasures", but move up and left to gain lip.  Traverse back right along the lip, topping out at the peak.

problems.name: Unknown Pleasures
problems.description: V8.  Sit-start matched on obvious jug.  Move up and right.

problems.name: An Ideal for Living
problems.description: V1.  Sit-start at far right end of lip.  Traverse the lip up and left, topping out at the peak.

problems.name: Chossorama
problems.description: V3/4. Start matched in hueco down left and on rubbishy feet, move right and up through better rock to lip and mantle. (FA Evan Erickson, 2007)

problems.name: Iron Choss
problems.description: V4. Sit start as for Chossorama; after the first couple of moves, traverse rightward on crimps around the arete until you gain the middle of the juggy slab. Climb up and top out here. (FA Trent Hoover, 2017)

problems.name: Chipler
problems.description: V1. Start low with left hand in good 3-finger pocket, and right hand in smaller but deep pocket immediately right. Climb up using edges and pockets. (FA Trent Hoover, 2017)

problems.name: Chipolina
problems.description: V1/2 Start to the right of Chipler, with left hand in deep 2-finger pocket, and right hand on blunt open-hand pinch immediately to the right. Pull on with difficulty, and climb onto the bulging slab above.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2017)

problems.name: Porcelain
problems.description: Sit-start with left hand on arete and right hand groping for anything on the underbelly of the boulder.  Use face holds, lip, and crack to head up and right.  Top-out just left of the rubble.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: Slasher
problems.description: An eliminate - but an obvious, logical, and fun one!  Start matched on the left end of the crack where it meets the arete.  Follow the crack right, through increasingly difficult holds and moves, until it meets the lip of the boulder.  Grab the horn to the right, and top out above.  The lip of the boulder above/left of the crack is out.  Sit-start, as per "Porcelain", to add a bit of length and difficulty.

problems.name: Arch Enemy
problems.description: V9.  Crouch-start with left-hand edge just above lip, and right-hand flake crimp just below lip.  Head directly up face above.

problems.name: The Cure
problems.description: Sit-start with good left-hand dimple hold on arete, and right on good flat edge. Follow slopers and edges up and right to a fun changing-angle topout.  (FA Kyle Marco, 2014)

problems.name: Placebo
problems.description: V8.  Sit-start using left-hand gaston edge, and right-hand on either another edge just below, or underclinging the low crack.  Move up into the finish of "The Disease".

problems.name: Placebo right
problems.description: V8.  Sit-start as per "Placebo" (left-hand gaston edge, right-hand low undercling in crack).  After first couple of moves (crux), continue right, working feet up ramp and pressing over into top of "Mantle Master".

problems.name: The Disease
problems.description: Stand-start using angling sloper shelf.  Move left to sharp twin-crimps.  Big move gains good lip holds, and top out.  (FA Evan Erickson, 2015)

problems.name: Mantle Asylum
problems.description: Start as per "Mantle Master".  Climb the first couple of moves on that problem, then traverse right, over the pit, using a large, broken jug, followed by long, deep, positive edges.

problems.name: Mantle Master
problems.description: Sit-start on blocky jugs under a large shelf.  Move up to the shelf, and a large sloper edge before executing a tricky press off sloping fins to a long, diagonal edge.  Continue up and slightly right to top out.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: Screaming Tendons
problems.description: V8.  Stand-start.  Pull on using opposing undercling edges under nose of blunt prow.  Violent first move leads to an easier finish, exiting right.  (FA Kim Lee, 2017)

problems.name: The Cure
problems.description: Sit-start with good left-hand dimple hold on arete, and right on good flat edge. Follow slopers and edges up and right to a fun changing-angle topout.  (FA Kyle Marco, 2014)

problems.name: Placebo
problems.description: V8.  Sit-start using left-hand gaston edge, and right-hand on either another edge just below, or underclinging the low crack.  Move up into the finish of "The Disease".

problems.name: Placebo right
problems.description: V8.  Sit-start as per "Placebo" (left-hand gaston edge, right-hand low undercling in crack).  After first couple of moves (crux), continue right, working feet up ramp and pressing over into top of "Mantle Master".

problems.name: The Disease
problems.description: Stand-start using angling sloper shelf.  Move left to sharp twin-crimps.  Big move gains good lip holds, and top out.  (FA Evan Erickson, 2015)

problems.name: Heart Attack Slab Centre
problems.description: This slab is slightly to your right when facing away from the problem "Porcelain", above.  Start standing in the pit, and climb the middle of the slab.  This line is tall and committing, with a bad landing and the crux at the top (going for the lip).

problems.name: Heart Attack Slab Right
problems.description: Climb the right side of the slab, with or without the blunt arete (hard to see in the photo, but it's just right of the red line, where the stripey rock turns a darker grey).  The feet are at strange angles, making this line balancy and slippery, with a threatening dagger of rock at your back.  Tread with caution!

problems.name: The Elitist
problems.description: V7.  Sit-start at middle of face, with thin, incut crimp for your left-hand, and a right-hand micro-crimp.  Move up and right to lip, then back left to top out at peak.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2014)

problems.name: Rose Tyler
problems.description: V1.  Stand-start with left-hand on sloping ledge/horn, and right-hand on whatever you can find.  Move up, and slightly right, on good edges. (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: Bad Wolf
problems.description: An aesthetic, technical highball.  Stand-start using sidepulls, and head towards the peak of the boulder via increasingly long and tenuous moves on okay holds, and poorly located and angled feet.

problems.name: Bad Wolf left
problems.description: V3.  Sit-start using low, incut left-hand edge, and higher right-hand sidepull edge.  Move up and left, joining the top of "Rose Tyler".

problems.name: Bad Wolf dihedral
problems.description: V3.  Sit-start at base of corner, using a slopey right-hand pinch, and either another slopey pinch or a prominent edge (on the lip of the corner) for your left-hand.  Press up into dihedral, and continue up.

problems.name: Smear And Giv'r
problems.description: V2. Stand-start with a good, high edge, and make a big move to a good edge up and right. From here, use the arete feature on your left to continue to the peak of the slab.

problems.name: Play It By Smear
problems.description: V0. On the south face of the Bad Wolf boulder. Step on with high left hand edge. Move straight up the highball face, keeping dihedral feature on your left to top out. Very nice flat landing. (FA Dan Anhorn, 2016)

problems.name: Lupa
problems.description: Sit/crouch start with a low right-hand sidepull, and left-hand undercling rail (or very low sidepull).  Make a couple of moves straight up, then decide between compressing the arete out left, or dynoing to the flat jug up and right.  Gain the shelf above, and top out.

problems.name: Lupa right
problems.description: Start as per "Lupa".  Dyno to the flat jug up and right, then continue up and right to a tricky top out.

problems.name: The Wizard's Apprentice
problems.description: V7/8.  Sit-start matched on massive left-facing jug-rail.  Traverse directly left, all the way around the arete, finishing up the slab.

problems.name: The Serpent's Coil
problems.description: V6.  Sit-start matched on the massive left-facing jug-rail.  Climb up and left, joining "Lupa".  (FA Mark Derksen, 2016)

problems.name: Tardis
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start, matched on huge left-facing jug.  Climb the right side of the face, using the arete on your right, and topping out directly onto the sloping topout.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2016)

problems.name: The Cutting Edge
problems.description: V6ish. Located ~20m east of the Lowensenf boulder. Sit-start with right-hand on a good sidepull low on the arete, and left-hand on a lower opposing edge in the face.Move up and left through a some technical moves on some good-but-sharp crimps.

problems.name: Abaddon sit
problems.description: V8.  Sit-start using a small, slick left-facing crimp low on the arête, and anything else at the same height or lower.  Move up and right, to join and finish on "Abaddon".

problems.name: Abaddon sit direct
problems.description: V6/7.  Start as per "Abaddon sit".  After the first move, head up and left, towards a blocky jug.

problems.name: Abaddon
problems.description: V6.  Stand-start, using a pair of side-by-side left-facing crimps/edges.  Move up and right, to the point of the steep arête, then back left to top out.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2014)

problems.name: Slice of Life
problems.description: Stand-start with a high crimp for your left hand, and a low pocket in the overhang for your right.  Dyno, or bump, your right-hand to the horn on the lip.  Continue left to top out.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2014)

problems.name: Slice of Life sit
problems.description: Sit-start using obvious incut right-hand sidepull, and either a sidepull crimp, or a pocket, for the left.  Gun for the arete, then up.

problems.name: The Mystery Direct
problems.description: V8/9.  Sit-start matched on obvious mini-jug. Move right-hand to a gaston, and crank to the lip from there.

problems.name: The Mystery
problems.description: V7ish. Sit-start using low right-hand sidepull, and left-hand on obvious mini-jug. Move up and right.

problems.name: Slice of Pie
problems.description: Sit-start using giant edge.  Climb straight up.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2014)

problems.name: Dab and Bomb
problems.description: V3. Sit start in between two blocks at East arete of Evan's Cave. Left hand on incut pinch in your face and right hand on incut side pull.  Power up to lip and mantle.

problems.name: Lowensenf traverse
problems.description: V7.  Sit-start matched on arête.  Traverse low and right, eventually topping out at the prow.
V0.  Sit-start with left-hand on arete, and right-hand on edge.  Climb right side of arete. (FA Kyle Marco, 2016)

problems.name: The Omen
problems.description: V2. Sit-start in left side of pit, with left-hand on incut edge, and right-hand lower.  Climb up and left.  (FA Dan Anhorn/Kyle Marco/Trent Hoover, 2016.)

problems.name: Deli Delight
problems.description: V5/6.  Sit-start in right side of pit, with left-hand on angling edge/crimp, and right-hand on low, large sidepull rail.  Move directly up face.   (FA Mark Derksen, 2016)

problems.name: Lowensenf
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start under arete/prow, with left-hand on a good incut, and right-hand on a lower edge.  Move up, to top out the prow feature.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2016.)

problems.name: Lowensenf Right
problems.description: V3.  Sit-start right of arete, with right-hand on high, sharp incut on rail, and left-hand on lower edge.  Climb up and right, onto slab, staying right of arete.  Both "Lowensenf" lines have been done from either start into either finish. (FA Dan Anhorn/Trent Hoover, 2016)

problems.name: Tomb Raider
problems.description: Super fun, unique problem in Frank!  Start matched on flat spot at far right end of lip.  Climb along the underside of the suspended dagger, using the lip on your right, and an opposing rail in the roof.  Juggier edges at the tip of the boulder lead to the topout.

problems.name: Cradle of Life
problems.description: Start as per "Tombraider".  Head immediately up the face above, via a tricky mantle.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Tomb Raider
problems.description: Super fun, unique problem in Frank!  Start matched on flat spot at far right end of lip.  Climb along the underside of the suspended dagger, using the lip on your right, and an opposing rail in the roof.  Juggier edges at the tip of the boulder lead to the topout.

problems.name: Cradle of Life
problems.description: Start as per "Tombraider".  Head immediately up the face above, via a tricky mantle.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Switchblade
problems.description: Start, and climb, as per "The Shiv", but extend the lip traverse all the way left to the blunt arete.  Upon reaching the arete, continue up the slab above.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: The Shiv
problems.description: Sit-start under nose of boulder, using opposing slopers.  Gain the lip of the boulder, and move slightly left to top out.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Hips and Lips
problems.description: Sit-start in pit, right-hand low on arete, left-hand on low sidepull.  Climb the left side of the arete.

problems.name: Coyote Den Overhang Left
problems.description: Sit-start matched on good, flat edge in middle of overhang.  Move left, then up, through rounded jugs to gain good shelf above lip.  Head slightly right to top out.

problems.name: Coyote Den Overhang Right
problems.description: Sit-start matched on good, flat edge in middle of overhang.  Reach right to the arete.  Use a combination of foot-trickery and raw power to gain the sloping lip above and slap up the arete.

problems.name: Coyote Den Overhang Left
problems.description: Sit-start matched on good, flat edge in middle of overhang.  Move left, then up, through rounded jugs to gain good shelf above lip.  Head slightly right to top out.

problems.name: Coyote Den Overhang Right
problems.description: Sit-start matched on good, flat edge in middle of overhang.  Reach right to the arete.  Use a combination of foot-trickery and raw power to gain the sloping lip above and slap up the arete.

problems.name: Coyote Den Slab Left
problems.description: Stand-start with left hand high on arete.  Smear your feet on, and lever yourself up to the lip.

problems.name: Event Horizon
problems.description: Step onto slab above pit/cave, and right of obvious, full-length hairline crack.  Head straight up, using crack to your left and sparse features right of that. Exciting finish.

problems.name: Coyote Den Slab Right
problems.description: You will find this boulder on your way to "Nintendo 69" from "Lipsmacker".  The slab in the picture faces in the direction of "Nintendo 69".  Nice slab line to the right of the pit landing, and left of the arete (arete is not used).

problems.name: Crown Jewel
problems.description: V4R/X.  Stand-start.  Climb the left side of obvious vertical rail feature.  Follow this feature as it heads left, to gain a finger-crack.  Follow the crack up to a few long moves gaining the top out.  Very sustained, physically and technically, and very, very tall.

problems.name: The Worm
problems.description: V7ish.  Stand-start at base of compression feature.  Climb directly up.

problems.name: The Slurm Queen
problems.description: V3/4.  Start using right-hand undercling and left-hand edge.  Traverse right, gaining arete to top out.  (FA J. Moir 2017)

problems.name: Petting the Worm
problems.description: V5ish.  Sit-start using large right-hand undercling and left-hand gaston in crack.  Move up and right, finishing by pressing up the right-facing corner.

problems.name: The Promised Land
problems.description: V6.  Stand-start, using good rail.  Follow the diagonal rail up and right, to a high crux gaining good edges below the lip, followed by a mantle on hard-to-locate holds.

problems.name: Tartarus
problems.description: V7ish.  Sit-start between tree and smaller bloc, using right-hand on lip of scoop, and left-hand anywhere lower.  Move up and left to left-facing holds, then head right to join "The Crucible".

problems.name: The Crucible
problems.description: V3ish.  Stand-start matched on long crimp.  Move up and left, then back right to a committing finish.

problems.name: The Crucible sit-start
problems.description: V5ish.  Sit-start using twin edges.  Move up and left to join the stand-start.

problems.name: KOA
problems.description:
Technically in Riverside Area, this boulder facing south  is on your left on the way past Fossil Fool to the westernmost river crossing used to get to Pilgrimage. Stand-start under apex of boulder. Climb up on obvious good edges. V0 variations possible left and right. 
Not a destination boulder. Do it if you are passing by on the way to Pilgrimage or camping. (FA Dan Anhorn 2015)

problems.name: Noodle left
problems.description: V3ish.  Sit-start under arete using low finger-jug on the left, and right-hand on the left start-hold of "Magic Carp direct".  Move up and left, topping out by pressing up and left onto the descent ramp.

problems.name: Noodle right
problems.description: V3ish.  Start as per "Noodle left", but head right after the first few moves, into the topout of "Magic Carp".

problems.name: Magic Carp Direct
problems.description: Sit/crouch-start using pair of obvious, large edges..  Head straight up. (FA Mark Derksen, 2014)

problems.name: Magic Carp
problems.description: Stand-start with a jug in the speckled dihedral. Climb left on side-pulls, and head up the more solid looking face, with a few tricky moves to the top. (FA Mark Derksen, 2014)

problems.name: Magic Carp Right
problems.description: V4ish.  Start as per "Magic Carp", but head directly up the compression feature, after the first few moves.

problems.name: The Angler
problems.description: V1+.  Stand-start just right of "Magic Carp", using a left-hand crimp at head-height on the slab, and a lower right-hand sloper.  Move up and right, along the leaning slab.  Top out right.

problems.name: The Fisher King sit-start
problems.description: V7+.  Sit-start using two obvious, low jug-edges.  Move up and right to gain the long crimp-rail, then up and left to the mantle in the scoop.

problems.name: The Fisher King
problems.description: V6.  Stand-start using good edges/jugs near arete.  Move up and left to a long, thin crimp rail, then way up and left to a jug-edge over the lip.  A tricky mantle into the scoop follows.

problems.name: Pilgrim's Progress
problems.description:
Start left of the descent ramp hop-off on good LH and RH sidepulls. Make a few moves leftwards until you are able to get out to the arete and tip back right onto the slab with a crimp. Tricky!  (FA Mark Derksen 2014)  

EDIT 2015: a key crimp has broken leaving the grade or viability of this route in question.

problems.name: Noodle left
problems.description: V3ish.  Sit-start under arete using low finger-jug on the left, and right-hand on the left start-hold of "Magic Carp direct".  Move up and left, topping out by pressing up and left onto the descent ramp.

problems.name: Noodle right
problems.description: V3ish.  Start as per "Noodle left", but head right after the first few moves, into the topout of "Magic Carp".

problems.name: The River King
problems.description: Stand-start, matched on huge edge/sloper.  Head up and slightly right, through huge, sloping shelves. (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Pantless
problems.description: Sit-start matched on the perfect ledge.  Move up into solid side-pulls and ledges all the way up. (FA Mark Derksen 2014)

problems.name: Bait and Switch
problems.description: V6ish.  Sit-start matched on low, large edge.  Traverse low and right, joining "The Tempest".

problems.name: The Fisher's Mark
problems.description: V1.  Start on a good, high edge.  Exit either left (into Pantless) or right (better).  (FA Trent Hoover, 2017)

problems.name: The Tempest
problems.description: Sit start in pit with  double underclings. Use great edges and side-pulls  to get to a mantle that is not a gimme. (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Hook
problems.description: V3ish.  Sit-start as per "Fisher King sit".  Move up and left to a large, flat jug, then traverse left into "The Fisher's Mark" or "Pantless".

problems.name: The Fisher King sit-start
problems.description: V7+.  Sit-start using two obvious, low jug-edges.  Move up and right to gain the long crimp-rail, then up and left to the mantle in the scoop.

problems.name: The Fisher King
problems.description: V6.  Stand-start using good edges/jugs near arete.  Move up and left to a long, thin crimp rail, then way up and left to a jug-edge over the lip.  A tricky mantle into the scoop follows.

problems.name: Catch and Release
problems.description: V5/6.  Sit-start matched on sloping edge.  Move up and right, heading for the groove on the slab.

problems.name: Mark's problem
problems.description: V5.  Crouch/sit-start matched on edge.  Move up and slightly left, heading for the groove on the slab.  (FA Mark Derksen)

problems.name: The Deadliest Catch low
problems.description: V5+.  Sit-start matched on long edge (as per unnamed V5), and move up and right to join "Deadliest Catch".

problems.name: The Deadliest Catch
problems.description: V3 to V5 range.  Stand-start by stepping onto the left-side of the scooped slab, using obvious right-hand mini-jug, and whatever you like for your left.  Move up and left via some tricky holds, a committing high-step, and an exhilarating finish.

problems.name: Achelous
problems.description: V3.  Sit-start matched on low shelf/edge-complex.  Move up the tall slab above.

problems.name: Cast Away
problems.description: V5ish.  Sit-start as per "Achelous", but move diagonally up and right using right-hand crimps and left-hand slopers/pinches, to join the top of "River King".  Technical and balancy on cool holds.

problems.name: A River Runs Through It
problems.description: V9ish.  Sit-start in small pit, using a good, vertical right-hand edge, and a left-hand gaston.  Cross left-hand up to a small crimp, and reach right to a pinch on the blunt corner.  Bump to the large, diagonal shelf, then continue into the top of "River King".

problems.name: The River King
problems.description: Stand-start, matched on huge edge/sloper.  Head up and slightly right, through huge, sloping shelves. (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Voyageur low
problems.description: V8+.  Sit-start as per "Magnesis low", and head up and right to join and finish on "Voyageur".

problems.name: Magnesis low
problems.description: V5.  Start very low, with obvious, thin right-hand crimp, and very low block on the arete (very near adjacent bloc).  A couple of moves lead to "Magnesis".  (FA Trent Hoover, 2017)

problems.name: Voyageur
problems.description: V7ish.  Sit-start matched on triangular jug at far left of face.  Follow slopey rails right to gain, and finish up, the arete.

problems.name: Magnesis
problems.description: V3.  Start as per "Voyageur", but head up and left to the arete.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2017)

problems.name: Stasis
problems.description: V3/4.  Sit-start using blocky jug for left-hand, and lower incut sidepull for right-hand.  Move up the left side of the arete, before rolling right to finish.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2017)

problems.name: Stasis
problems.description: V3/4.  Sit-start using blocky jug for left-hand, and lower incut sidepull for right-hand.  Move up the left side of the arete, before rolling right to finish.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2017)

problems.name: Lodge
problems.description: V1. Sit start under "wedge" overhang, left hand side-pull, right hand head-height crimp. Pull up onto slab, top out straight up. (FA Dan Anhorn, 2017)

problems.name: Breath of the Wild
problems.description: V0.  Climb the natural line to the peak of the slab.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2017)

problems.name: The Dock
problems.description: V2. Start  left hand on a small incut edge at chest height, and right hand on finger jug. Climb up and left along good holds, using leaning arete to topout. Be prepared for a difficult descent. (FA Trent Hoover, 2017)

problems.name: The Sweet Science
problems.description: V6ish.  Sit-start matched on obvious incut edge.  A powerful move up and left to a good sloper on the lip is followed by a tricky and committing topout.

problems.name: The Clinch
problems.description: V4ish.  Sit-start under overhanging side of arete, using a triangular right-hand pinch in the overhang, and left-hand compressing the arete slightly lower.  Climb the steep side of the arete at first, before rolling left to gain a juggy edge.  Top out left or right from there.

problems.name: The Clinch
problems.description: V4ish.  Sit-start under overhanging side of arete, using a triangular right-hand pinch in the overhang, and left-hand compressing the arete slightly lower.  Climb the steep side of the arete at first, before rolling left to gain a juggy edge.  Top out left or right from there.

problems.name: The Contender
problems.description: V3ish.  Sit-start matched on left end of the dirty jug-rail.  Move left to good, pinchy edges, then continue up and left through some tricky moves.  Excellent moves on very cool holds.

problems.name: The Ali Shuffle
problems.description: V1ish.  Sit-start matched on dirty jug-rail.  Move up and right, using obvious undercling rail to gain the lip. Shuffle slightly left to top out.

problems.name: On the Ropes
problems.description: V4ish.  Stand-start using opposing edges (left-hand is high, right-hand is low).  Move up and left (using an inconspicuous hold) to gain the lip, then head right to top out.

problems.name: Snag n' Fly
problems.description: Sit-start.  Climb the center of the face.

problems.name: Holds Will Break
problems.description: Sit-start.  Climb right side of face, through slopey shelf.

problems.name: Snag n' Fly Arete
problems.description: Sit-start.  Climb the arete.

problems.name: FIght or Flight
problems.description: Up the slab, using the left arete.

problems.name: Don't Try This at Home
problems.description: Eliminate.  Climb the middle of the tall slab until you can grab the flat top (both aretes are out).  High, sequential, committing, and a bit fragile . . . you're likely to get more than you bargained for.

problems.name: Donkey Rocket
problems.description: Sit-start using right-facing sidepull/undercling feature.  Climb the tricky face above, without drifting left to the arete.

problems.name: Menstrual Crimps
problems.description: Sit-start using opposing sidepull edges, at the left end of the undercut feature.  Head up through thin, incut crimps.

problems.name: Coalbanks Revolution
problems.description: Sit-start on low, positive edges.  Highly interesting, enjoyable movement up the unique double-arete feature makes this one a gem at the grade!

problems.name: Leftist Revolution
problems.description: Sit-start.  Climb the left side of the arete.

problems.name: Little Trundle of Joy
problems.description: Located prominently up on a ridge, about 150-meters south-east of the Mushroom boulder (or 200-meters north-west of the Giant).  Sit-start matched on juggy, square-cut sidepull.  Power up and left on sloping rails and edges.  Top out the right side of the big scoop (relatively easy, but don't blow it!).

problems.name: Otter Surprise
problems.description: Sit-start on good, angled rail.  Climb the face above.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Expected  Surprise Left
problems.description: Start as per "Expected Surprise".  Head up and left.

problems.name: Expected Surprise
problems.description: Sit-start matched on good, angled rail.  Climb the face up and right, towards a shelf at about two-thirds height.

problems.name: Worm Face
problems.description: Many V0 lines all over this interesting slab on the north face of Expected Surprise boulder.

problems.name: V for Victory
problems.description: Sit-start with left-hand on the bottom of the arête (the bottom of the V), and right-hand on a lower sidepull edge far to the right. Climb up with trickery.  Exit right using a big pinch.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: V for Valour
problems.description: Start as for "V For Victory", but head left at the lip, working feet up the ramp.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: X Factor
problems.description: Sit-start between two boulders, with hands on two crimps at face-height.  Climb straight up bulge on perfect holds.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Blood Simple
problems.description: V8ish.  Stand-start using a sharp left-hand sidepull, and a smooth right-hand edge.  Power up the short face.

problems.name: Painted Glass
problems.description: Stand-start.  Climb the left side of the arete.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Mike
problems.description: Sit-start in gap between boulders, right-hand using low crimp on the arete, left-hand using lowest, nearest sidepull edge.  Move up to the large shelf.  Traverse right, turning the arete, and use series of cracks to top out in the huge V-notch.

problems.name: Amtal Rule
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start using large left-hand sidepull, and anything lower for right-hand.  Climb up and onto ramp, then up and over lip.

problems.name: Crysknife
problems.description: V3/4.  Sit-start, and climb directly up centre of face.

problems.name: Fedaykin
problems.description: V0.  Sit-start using corner feature under arete.  Climb up to arete, and follow its left side to the peak of the boulder.

problems.name: Kwisatz Haderach
problems.description: V6.  Start, and climb, as per "Bi-La Kaifa", but roll onto the slab at the midpoint of the lip traverse.

problems.name: Bi-La Kaifa
problems.description: V6.  Start as per "Ayat".  Upon gaining the lip, traverse left, topping out at the far left end.

problems.name: Burhan
problems.description: V2.  Start as per "Ayat", but head directly up onto slab.

problems.name: Ayat
problems.description: V1.  Sit-start at base of arete, using low left-hand sidepull, and right-hand on one of the blocky holds.  Move up to lip, then traverse right, to join "Amtal Rule".

problems.name: Amtal Rule
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start using large left-hand sidepull, and anything lower for right-hand.  Climb up and onto ramp, then up and over lip.

problems.name: Maud ' Dib
problems.description: V8/9.  Stand-start, matched on pinch on lip.  Traverse lip all the way left, topping out at arete.  The lower boulder (the start of "Usul") is not used in this problem.

problems.name: Usul
problems.description: V7/8.  Sit-start, matched on large horn jug on detached bloc.  Move up and into "Maud ' Dib".  Easier because the start jug provides a large foot that is not part of "Maud 'Dib".

problems.name: Ithaqua
problems.description: V6/7.  Start matched on edge at far left end of lip.  Move up and right to lip, then continue traversing the lip all the way right, into the finish of "Wendigo".

problems.name: Wechuge
problems.description: V5.  Start down and left from "Windigo", with right-hand undercling in roof-crack, and left-hand on wide, slopey rail.  Head up and left, along lip of boulder, eventually gaining a left-hand arete feature on the slab.

problems.name: Windigo
problems.description: V5.  Start right-hand on incut sidepull above lip, left-hand on lower, flat edge.  Climb up and right on sloping and rounded holds.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: Guyline
problems.description: V7.  Start with right-hand pinching slopey corner of large rail, and left-hand on a higher slopey edge.  Head straight up.

problems.name: The Wind and the Wizard low
problems.description: V7.  Sit-start with opposing sidepull rails low in overhang (left-hand rail is higher).  A couple of powerful/tensiony moves link into the regular "Wind and the Wizard" sequence.

problems.name: Telekinesis Low
problems.description: V7/8.  Start as per "Wind and the WIzard low", and join "Telekinesis".

problems.name: Telekinesis
problems.description: V6/7.  Start as per "Wind and the Wizard".  Gain holds above the lip of the overhang, and traverse left, topping-out in the same place as "Guyline".

problems.name: The Wind and the Wizard
problems.description: V5.  Start matched on good edge below lip.  Head up and right.  (FA Kyle Marco)

problems.name: Windwalker
problems.description: V1.  Sit-start matched on obvious juggy edge in overhang.  Move up and right, to right-facing corner feature, using this to press further right onto short slab.

problems.name: Windwalker direct
problems.description: V2.  Start as per "Windwalker", but climb the slab directly above, using the corner feature on your right.

problems.name: The Empire Strikes Back
problems.description: Sit-start and traverse the rising lip from left to right.

problems.name: Sith Lord
problems.description: Sit-start under right arete/lip, and head straight up, using undercling block.

problems.name: Vector Analysis
problems.description: Sit-start using low left-hand on the arete, and thin, incut crimp in the overhang for your right.  Climb the underside of the overhanging arete.

problems.name: Nose Warmer
problems.description: Sit-start matched in crack.  Traverse top to right.

problems.name: Pince Nez
problems.description: Sit-start under bulge, with left-hand dimple on lip, and right-hand pinching the blunt corner.  Climb directly over bulge, and up face above.

problems.name: Sphincter
problems.description: Start as per "Pinch Parade", but head directly up through scoop.  (Kyle Marco & Evan Erickson climbed a problem on this boulder, naming it "Sphincter".  Exact original problem has been forgotten, so the name has been applied to this line)

problems.name: Pinch Parade
problems.description: Sit-start right of the arete, using left-hand sloper in concave feature below lip, and right-hand on a very small, sharp crimp in the overhang.  Follow lip holds up and right, eventually topping out above the rock on your right.  Can exit early up the left-leaning crack, at the same grade.

problems.name: Nose Warmer
problems.description: Sit-start matched in crack.  Traverse top to right.

problems.name: Lock Jaw
problems.description: Sit-start, left-hand gastoning rail, and right-hand on pinch just above.  Head up and left.  (FA Dan Anhorn, 2016)

problems.name: Pince Nez
problems.description: Sit-start under bulge, with left-hand dimple on lip, and right-hand pinching the blunt corner.  Climb directly over bulge, and up face above.

problems.name: Tusk
problems.description: Crouch-start using obvious pocket/pod on right side of prow, and sloping edge at the same height on the left side of the prow.  A very dabby, frustrating first couple of moves lead to wonderful compression climbing up the overhanging dagger.

problems.name: Destitution
problems.description: Sit-start with right-hand on obvious sidepull block, and left-hand anywhere lower.  Head left into edges, up through more edges, then left again into tricky sloper finish.

problems.name: Destitution direct
problems.description: Start, and climb, as per "Destitution".  At mid-height, set up for a big move to the positive lip.

problems.name: Debauchery
problems.description: Start as per "Deliverance".  At mid-height, move left to join the top of " Destitution direct".

problems.name: Deliverance sit-start
problems.description: A direct sit-start to "Deliverance", starting with incut right-hand undercling, and anything lower for the left-hand.

problems.name: Deliverance
problems.description: Stand-start in the pit, using a line of crimps at around 7.5'.  Move left up to a thin, textureless sidepull crimp, then head up and slightly right through a couple of slopey, opposing edges, followed by a heady throw to the lip.

problems.name: Despair
problems.description: Sit-start as per "Deliverance sit".  After the first few moves, make a long push out right to an arcing crimp.  Match, and head to the top.

problems.name: Despair direct
problems.description: Sit-start using low, opposing sidepulls.  Head straight up, joining the finish of "Despair".

problems.name: Destitution direct
problems.description: Start, and climb, as per "Destitution".  At mid-height, set up for a big move to the positive lip.

problems.name: Destitution
problems.description: Sit-start with right-hand on obvious sidepull block, and left-hand anywhere lower.  Head left into edges, up through more edges, then left again into tricky sloper finish.

problems.name: Despair
problems.description: Sit-start as per "Deliverance sit".  After the first few moves, make a long push out right to an arcing crimp.  Match, and head to the top.

problems.name: Debauchery
problems.description: Start as per "Deliverance".  At mid-height, move left to join the top of " Destitution direct".

problems.name: Deliverance
problems.description: Stand-start in the pit, using a line of crimps at around 7.5'.  Move left up to a thin, textureless sidepull crimp, then head up and slightly right through a couple of slopey, opposing edges, followed by a heady throw to the lip.

problems.name: Deliverance sit-start
problems.description: A direct sit-start to "Deliverance", starting with incut right-hand undercling, and anything lower for the left-hand.

problems.name: Despair direct
problems.description: Sit-start using low, opposing sidepulls.  Head straight up, joining the finish of "Despair".

problems.name: Trapeze Traverse
problems.description: Sit-start just right of left-facing rail, using opposing holds below the lip (left-hand on rail, and right-hand on a sidepull crimp).  Cruxy and tricky avoiding dab on first couple of moves, but great slopers and mantle afterwards.

problems.name: Trapeze Arete
problems.description: Sit-start matched on large, flat jug low on arete.  Climb directly up arete, to a tricky top-out.

problems.name: Lunge
problems.description: Start matched on corner of lip/arete.  Traverse right, through the face, to gain the high rail of "Pushup", and top out at the peak.

problems.name: Pushup
problems.description: Sit-start with left-hand undercling and right-hand sidepull.  Climb direct to peak.

problems.name: Pullup
problems.description: Sit-start at arete with fat left-hand pinch, and lower edge for right.  Climb up and left, along arete, to the peak of the boulder.

problems.name: Ripple Effect
problems.description: Sit-start with obvious right-hand block sidepull, and anything lower for left.  Head up and left, using nebulous edges and sloping ramp, eventually gaining arete and topping out above.

problems.name: Troglodyte
problems.description: Sit-start low in cave, using tiny, but good, right-hand slot-crimp, and anything lower for left.  Head up and left.

problems.name: Troglodyte
problems.description: Sit-start low in cave, using tiny, but good, right-hand slot-crimp, and anything lower for left.  Head up and left.

problems.name: Pushup
problems.description: Sit-start with left-hand undercling and right-hand sidepull.  Climb direct to peak.

problems.name: Ripple Effect
problems.description: Sit-start with obvious right-hand block sidepull, and anything lower for left.  Head up and left, using nebulous edges and sloping ramp, eventually gaining arete and topping out above.

problems.name: Cyril Sneer
problems.description: V0/1.  Stand-start.

problems.name: Zombotron Arete
problems.description: V7.  Sit-start under belly of arete, using a smooth left-hand edge, and shallow right-hand pocket.  One hard move leads to smooth jugs.  (FA Marcus Norman)

problems.name: Zombotron 2000
problems.description: V6/7.  Sit-start matched on right-facing edge.  Power up to the lip.  Shuffle right a bit to top out.  (FA Evan Erickson, 2007)

problems.name: Zombotron Arete
problems.description: V7.  Sit-start under belly of arete, using a smooth left-hand edge, and shallow right-hand pocket.  One hard move leads to smooth jugs.  (FA Marcus Norman)

problems.name: Squeeze Theorem
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start with left-hand on obvious edge, and right-hand on lowest good sidepull.  Climb the compression feature and arete.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2013)
V2.  Sit start, with left-hand on leaning rail, and right-hand low on sidepull/pinch.  Follow the line of edges, trending left to top-out.

problems.name: Tequila Mockingbird
problems.description: V1.  Sit-start on flat rock, using opposing, good sidepulls.  Go up arête, and top out just left.  (FA Dan Anhorn, 2016)

problems.name: Tequila Mockingbird Low
problems.description: V2/3.  Sit-start in overhang right of arete, matched on sloper/edges in triangular alcove.  Bust some moves left into the start of "Tequila Mockingbird", and finish up that arete.  (FA Dan Anhorn, 2016)

problems.name: Speakeasy
problems.description: V1.  Sit-start the same as, or just right of, "Tequila Mockingbird low".  Climb directly up the face above, to the middle of the lip, and mantle onto the slab.

problems.name: Cave Troll
problems.description: V3.  Sit start left hand on sloper on arete, and right hand on blocky hold just under lip in cave. Move to corner of arete and up. (FA Mark Derksen, 2014)

problems.name: Cave Troll
problems.description: V3.  Sit start left hand on sloper on arete, and right hand on blocky hold just under lip in cave. Move to corner of arete and up. (FA Mark Derksen, 2014)

problems.name: Morphologic
problems.description: V4. Sit start matched either on 'molar-tooth' jug or right hand on  jug and left hand on angled gaston. A huge move leads to a good edge, tricky moves on good holds will deliver you to a great mantle.

problems.name: Hydra Low
problems.description: V4/5. Sit start, almost lying down to right of Arete, right hand on obvious sloper right of arête, left hand on good but small textured edge notched into arête. With trickery, climb textured holds up  left side of arête, top out at flat top of the boulder (or continue across lip to an easier mantle if you wish). (FA Trent Hoover, 2018)

problems.name: Fascistitus
problems.description: V2.  To the left of "Spar", sit-start left of short arête, using left-hand sidepull/undercling, and right-hand on low, positive sidepull.  Move up left of arête, through positive holds.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2016)

problems.name: Spar
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start using large, low left-hand sidepull, and right-hand on sloper sidepull.  Head up through good holds.  (FA Dan Anhorn, 2016)

problems.name: Yardarm
problems.description: V4. Start in left of alcove, with left-hand sidepull, and obvious right-hand  gaston.  Head up and right, to join "Nautilus".  (FA Dan Anhorn, 2016)

problems.name: Nautilus direct
problems.description: V6/7.  Stand-start as per "Nautilus", but climb directly to peak above start, along left-side of arête.

problems.name: Nautilus
problems.description: V6. Stand-start using large left-hand sidepull in overhang, and right-hand low on arete.  Head up and left, topping out up the slab. (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Nautical Disaster
problems.description: V1/2.  Stand-start using good right-hand sloper/rail on slab, and left-hand on whatever you'd like in the overhang.  Bump left-hand up arete, enabling a committing rock-over and top-out up the slab above the river.

problems.name: Old Man and the Sea
problems.description: V2/3.  Stand-start with left-hand pinching arête, and right-hand on edge.  Compression moves lead to an airy top out.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2016)

problems.name: No Guts
problems.description:
V2. Stand-start with left-hand on high crimp, right-hand on sloper pinch.  Climb the tall face using decent edges.  Landing may become wet or submerged in spring and early summer. 
(FA Dan Anhorn, 2015)

problems.name: No Gory
problems.description:
V0/1. Stand-start using left-hand gaston, and right-hand crimp with thumb-catch.  Follow crimps and edges to somewhat slopey mantle.  
(FA Dan Anhorn, 2015)

problems.name: Captain Barnacles
problems.description: V0.  Sit-start matched on large edge.  Move into undercling, and engage the bulge with good holds.  (FA Trent Hoover and Dan Anhorn, 2016)
